1.content:
**Starts with Eric's story, other characters are on the last option. Thank you **

At the Prower family house, only a few hours after Robotnik takes Mobotropolis

"The morning glories are looking nice this year Amadeus." Rosemary smiled as she tended to her garden beside their house, culling the flowers that weren't surviving while her husband worked beside her. " Now that the Great War is over, you could help out a bit more around the garden dear."

Amadeus just chuckled and pulled a rather damaged red tulip from the soil as he wiped some of the dirt off his knees. "Compared to the Great War, helping around the house is nothing. Tell me, is Tails still with the other children?"

"Yes, he will be at Acorn's palace for another hour, then I was going to send Eric to bring him back. You know how fidgety he gets when he stays inside too long, wanting to take off flying like his little bird friends." Rosemary showed her husband the trio of birds on the windowsill of the house, outside the room of their first son.

"I think Eric would like that, but we should remind to take his time, instead of rushing back so soon. I'm starting to think he is avoiding Tails' friends on purpose." Amadeus stated bluntly as he pulled another tulip out, now thinking on what he was going to say to his son when the time came to it...

Inside the Prower home, Eric's room

Eric was repairing one of the clocks that broke in his room while his parents worked on the garden outside. Even though he was only 6, he had a knack for fixing things. Even Rotor, who was honored with the same gift and a few years older than him, said that he should keep up the good work and practice regularly. Not too far from him, Copper,Lead and Nickel were standing on his windowsill, watching him work without making too much noise.

The birds had claimed Eric as family when he saved Nickel from a large snake as a few years back, so they stuck around to make sure he was safe like one of the kids. They saved him from serious danger more than once from tweeting and directing him away from threats so his mother and father were thankful enough to let them stay around.

Once Eric had finished fixing his clock, he placed it onto his dresser before he heard something that would haunt him for the rest of his life.

He heard his mother scream, before he heard a few loud zaps and flashes of light from his window. Confused and scared, Eric went to the window to find out what happened when he saw a group of Swatbots holding his unconscious parents before loading them onto a ship that landed nearby. A large fat man and a small skinny man were talking in the distance but Eric recognized them to be Julian Robotnik and his assistant Snively.

"Ha, the Great General Amadeus and his wife, they will be proud trophies for my citizens to see." Robotnik laughed as he sent the ship away. "If memory serves, he should have two sons in the house. Find them and bring them out here, alive." At once Robotnik's Swatbots went into the house to find Eric and Tails, but only found Eric, who was in shock while third birds tried to protect him from the robots.

It only took the Swatbots 9 seconds to kill the birds before dragging Eric out of the house by his two tails, while he kicked and scream and swore with words he really shouldn't have learned at that age, out to the grinning madman that was Robotnik. "Only one subject was in the house sir." A Swatbot reported to Robotnik as he held Eric in the air by his tails in front the fat monster.

"And where is your brother dear child?" Robotnik asked Eric while he rubbed his hand through Eric's hair with a smirk, which quickly changed to a snarl as Eric bite down hard on his hand, pulling his starting to bleed hand back before more damage could be done. "You will regret that worm, I will enjoy roboticzing you. Take him away, knock him out if you have to."

Eric tried to struggle one more time before something dense hit the side of his head and all he could feel was himself falling into darkness of unconsciousness...

11.content:
Later that day...

Eric woke up to a cold floor that felt like ice and slowly got up as his head still throbbed violently. Eric then slowly looked around and saw he was in a cell and felt his eyes tear up and started to cry and wail a little. He missed his family, his birds, and his friends, all of which were taken from him by Robotnik. The thought of Robotnik filled Eric with an emotion he never felt before, wrath. In a blind rage, Eric punched the wall next to him and flinched as his soft hand started to bleed and throb as bad as his head, promoting another wave of crying.

"Hey, shut up!" A rather harsh voice across the room yelled at Eric, which came from a rather large beefy Lion, also stuck in a cell. "You're not the only one with problems you spoiled brat! So do us all a favor and shut the fuck up so we can sleep before we get changed!" The lion growled before he flipped his back to Eric, who was shocked that the lion was so violent with him and scared of being hurt again, so he moved to a corner and tried to calm himself down.

In his cowering, Eric noticed that there was a beam of light directed at the center of his room and looked up to find a barred window. Without any hesitation, he tried to climb the wall to look out the window, which was harder to do with one of his hands possibly broken yet he managed to get his eyes up enough to look out into the world. It was already sunset and he managed to see a lot of Mobotropolis, so he must've been held somewhere close to the palace. He thought about yelling and scream out for help, but the Lion scared him too much and his voice was lost on him.

Eric started to shake and let himself rest back on the cold ground, clutching his now swollen and bruised hand. He tried to just sleep, hoping that it was just a nightmare and his mother Rosemary would help him forget it...

The next morning...

Eric woke up to sound of metal joints whining as his cell door opened, in front of him was a very large Swatbot who stood like a statute. "Get moving prisoner, Robotnik demands your presence." Eric however noticed could try to run past the Swatbot and get away from the cell he was forced into. He could even try to break the robot since he still had a mini screwdriver in his pocket from fixing his clock before.

Eric stood up and also tried to think of other ways to get free while the Swatbot stood motionless outside his cell door.
11.title: Eric, age 6- 19, prisoner of Robotnik

111.content:
Eric was just a six year old fox who had never gotten into a situation that others couldn't help him out of it, he even slept with a light on, how could he possibly react quick enough to get free? He saw no other real choice that wouldn't get him hurt more than he already was, so he stood up and walked out of the cell, following the Swatbot while holding his injured hand. He then realized when they walked down the corridor, that there was a small army of Swatbots waiting at the exit, with large, lethal weaponry.

After being put on an elevator that seemed to go on forever, The Swatbot lead Eric to a massive chamber with large computer monitors on top of the biggest computer Eric had ever seen. If not for the bad conditions, Eric would've went over to the computer and started to take it apart to find out how it worked. Yet the guards surrounding it seemed to deter that idea as Eric was forced to kneel on a large circular pattern on the floor, while the chair in front of him turned and a sitting Robotnik faced him with a rather dark frown.

"Being a merciful overlord that I am, I will give you one last chance to answer my question I asked you when we found you. I want you to take your time with this, as the wrong answer will keep you in that little room you woke up in and your parents in their room. The truthful response will get you and your family free to go." Robotnik droned as he stared at the blue fox beneath him. "Where is that brother of yours and his friends?"

Eric clenched his hands and looked down in fear of the red eyes watching him, like a mouse caught by a large cobra. "The last I saw Tails was went he was going to the palace to play with his friends. I don't know where he would go, or where he is now, please let us go." Eric answered truthfully as he looked Robotnik in the eyes.

Robotnik stated to play with his mustache while he thought about Eric's answer, yet he stood up and walked over to the computer. "Isn't she a beauty? More processing power than any computer to date, and connected to every camera in Mobotropolis. This is why I believe you, my dear boy as I saw your brother here in the garden with a number of his friends."

Eric sighed in relief and actually started to smile. "Oh thank you Mr. Robotnik. Can I leave with my parents now?"

"No."

Eric was confused for a second and thought he misheard Robotnik. "I'm sorry sir?"

"That wasn't all I was looking for Prower," Robotnik answered as he faced Eric again, this time with his robot hand on top of a button. "I'm sure you have some idea where Tails and his friends went, tell me or the same rules apply."

"But sir... I told you I don't know. I only know a couple of Tails' friends, I have no idea where they'd be other than the palace."

"Then tell me the names you do know." Robotnik stated as his hand moved a bit up from the button.

Eric tried to think and also wondered what the button Robotnik was almost touching would do, but didn't want to know. "Well, um, Sally Acorn, Sonic, uh and... some rabbit?" He left out his knowledge of Rotor, since he looked up to him like a brother and didn't want to get him hurt.

Robotnik then pressed a different button and what sounded like a recording of Eric's scared voice played his statement again. "Is that all you have to offer?" He asked when the recording was done.

"Um...yes sir? Now can I go be with my Mom and Dad?"

Eric heard a chuckle come from Robotnik, before his hand laid on the button he was touching before. "No, but I will give you a place as my first roboticizer victim!" Robotnik then pressed the button with an evil laugh as a machine came from below Eric and started to surround him.

Eric was trying to figure out a way of the roboticizer when he remembered his screwdriver in his pocket. He then frantically twisted the screws off of whatever parts he could reached to break the machine. When a light started to shine beneath him, Eric tried to rip parts off with his bare hands and for a second it seemed like he was disabling the machine when the light flickered and sparks started to fly.

Outside, Eric could hear alarms and yelling but the machine's whine was deafening to hear exactly what was said but Eric could tell that things weren't going to their plans. Eric almost smiled but it was quickly wiped away when the light came back and was even brighter than before, almost burning his retinas when he looked down at it, like the sun was magnified directly on him.

However, Eric opened one eye to see what he was facing and saw something strange. The parts of the machine he tore off were floating around him in a circle as more parts were being torn off from the gears.They then glowed red before they each attached to his body, burning into his skin, fusing to his body.

Yet Eric couldn't feel a thing, even as he saw a large part go for his head, he didn't flinch as it attached to the left side of his head, covering an eye. It was only when several currents of electricity went through his body, focusing primarily in the machine parts, caused him to pass out within seconds before the change was complete. When the protective cover was lowered, Robotnik saw what had happened and yet instead of getting angry, he actually looked pleased with his new creation.
111.title: Fate smiles to few, and curses the many

1111.content:
Robotnik looked at the cyborg fox laying on the ground in front of him and wonder what he had just given creation to. It was what he wanted, yet the fox had altered the process enough to keep at least half of his form. Robotnik scanned the cyborg and found that while he had control, the boy could choose to accept it or could break free. He was so close to perfection, and with a few new alterations, all who went into the roboticizer would be true robots, all thanks to little Eric Prower.

Even thought the boy could be a hassle, Robotnik saw potential of a new agent. He would have to be trained of course, and fed, but he would be the one who could take down any sort of resistance King Acorn may have, including Princess Sally, without others seeing him as a threat. A true shadow agent, who would be called Ironfist from now on.

"Snively," Robotnik spoke to his assistant in almost a breathless voice. "Put him in a private cell, off the records, and run tests on his capabilities in the labs. I want a report before I go to sleep tonight, do you understand?" Snively was still a little in shock but he nods and gets a Swatbot to carry Eric out of the room, to the labs for testing...

11111.content:
Eric thrashed in his sleep until he awoke to another cell room floor, yet the tiger wasn't across from his cell. It seemed he was placed in a private cell, somewhere high up in a tower since the room was circular. Eric scratched his head to get rid of a painfully annoying itch and found that he was bleeding from his forehead. Alarmed, he tore off his sleeve and pressed it against his head. Eric then wondered why he suddenly felt so heavy and how he got to the cell.

That is when the pieces of the puzzle came into place.

Eric then raised both of his hands and realized that one of half of his body was mechanical or better put, robotic. He couldn't move his left arm or leg and his left eye was just pitch black. Eric the looked for a mirror or some kind of reflecting surface, something to see what that roboticzier did to him, and saw a puddle of rainwater forming under his window. Eric didn't noticed it was raining but quickly looked into the water forming to see the extent of the damage.

He saw a dirty, matted, cyborg freak fox look back at him with shock and fear. Eric grabbed at his face and touched where he was changed, including his new robotic eye, which was not turned on. Wrath filled him again and he grit his teeth, Robotnik would pay for robbing him of his family, his friends and roboticzing him. Eric then checked his pockets for his screwdriver and could not find it.

"Hey freak." a voice in the shadows of his cell sneered at him, prompting Eric to face the shadows as a small man, not much taller than him appeared. "Comfortable? As of now, you are property of Robotnik's. You will do everything we demand and you will live, if not, I can permanently unplug you right now. The first thing you will do, is stick out your arm through the bars, the flesh one."

Eric was scared but slowly pushed his normal arm through the bars of his cell to the small man who gripped his arm like a vice. "Good, hold still." Eric was confused until he felt a needle pierce his arm and almost thrashed before a large gun was put to his forehead. "You will remain still or I will shoot, just try me." Eric mumbled a bit before he stopped fighting and saw the entire vial fill with red before the man pulled the needle out. "There we go, and if you thrash again, Commander Snively will punish you." 1111111.content:
Eric slowly awoke not in his little cell in the tower, but laid on a vertical table then had large steel bars holding him in place as he rested against the cold metal. "Good you're awake." Eric looked over and saw the small man again, Snively the Commander, in front of a large panel that had wires connected to him. "Because of your little tampering, your new body does not have any power to start itself like a normal unit. So we have to charge you up like a reusable battery until you can move and make your own power." Snively gripped a lever and smiled cruelly. "This will hurt."

Eric couldn't even yell before the lever flipped and electricity coursed through his body like dropping a powerline into a pool of water with him engulfed. Eric screamed and yelled his lungs out and thrashed violently, convulsing in his restraints, screaming out pleads for mercy and to be free. Yet he didn't get any mercy as he felt his body suddenly hurt less and less until he realized he could move his left side and could see out of his left eye. Although it seemed like the world was in green and scales and charts flew past his sight of his body and conditions. He almost felt like he had full control of himself, despite being half scrap metal.

That's when he heard it.

"Scanning... charge holding at 50%, basic systems stabilized. Scan complete. Warning, unidentified platform located, begining threat scan..."

"What, what is that? It feels like something is inside my head!" Eric yelled as he held his head and tried to find what was causing the robotic voice to boom loudly around his mind.

"Oh, that. That is your new system, the one that will replace and improve yourself to a status above any normal person. Provided you train, as of now you could hardly handle any serious combat, let alone walk." Snively spoke matter of factly before he released the bars holding Eric in place and watched him collapse the ground. "You currently have the equivalent of a hundred and fifty pounds of metal attached permanently to your meager 75 pounds. It will take time, but you will learn to adapt to it and make it your ally in any situation beyond these walls. But if not, you will make a good paperweight for Dr. Robotnik, it doesn't matter much in the end."

Eric felt his head buzz before he heard the voice again, still booming loudly in his head. "Scan complete, identity as Eric Flint Prower, age 6 years and three months, threat level- No creditable threat. Hello Eric, you are now synced with Robotnik's newest design robotization control system CGA9-DTPL-7R0H. You now have access to the main computer to receive orders from your one true master Dr. Julien Robotnik, as well as basic motor control of all improved limbs. Warning, any attempts to disobey your master will be dealt with extreme force. Access your system by the screen in your forearm to check your current status , and have a pleasant day."

"Alright, you can play with yourself in your cell. Swatbot, carry him out of here!" Snively yelled out before a Swatbot came and lugged him away to his cell.
1111111.title: Freedom of restrictions comes at a price..

choices: One night, locked in his tower...
Running laps in a maze, the time strikes!
11111112.content:
The world changed rapidly for the young two tailed fox, his entire life was uprooted and changed into a freak of nature. Eric was put through hell with several experiments that were test his limits and abilities to real life situations. Runs against time, with certain motivation if he were to stop, drugs, stress tests were a daily requirement. He would often crash the second the day was over, only to be woken up to loud screams and robotic dogs. Eventually, Eric grew stronger each day that he was subjected to the torture, but he didn't stop attempting to escape. In three years, he had tried to get away countless times, but he would always fail. His battery would be too low and shut him down, he would get caught climbing down the side of the tower, and even was caught hiding in one of the bathrooms that had a few guards inside who heard him. He had made his system less deafening in his ears when it gave tactical advice that he could never do, he managed to walk almost the same as before but he couldn't slouch like before, as his spine had been changed as well, making him stand straight.

Yet he wasn't as clueless as before, he learned a lot from his kidnappers, particularly the short man known as Snively. Eric learned to make every second count with using his resources for the best possible result days later, a skill that helped him with "borrowing" objects to break out of his cell with many times before. He also learned that having an ear around all corners came in handy, especially when you hear something important like codes for doors or shifts of guards. Of course he was caught and punished until he could barely move his body, but he had also learned how to managed the intensity of pain, so he almost hardened up so it would damage him as much. Yet he still dreamed of the outside, free from the bars on windows and existence he called a life in his cell, dancing for the fat man Robotnik every day.

He wasn't even sure why he was pushed this way anymore, at first he thought it was because he was defenseless and easy. But yet the specific manners how he was tortured had him almost curious for what kind of purpose he was to have. But he didn't plan for sticking around, he had a makeshift pick and rake from a pen and bobby pin he found in the maze, hoping the previous owner was alright, as well as a listening device so he could hear around him for farther. It was a matter of when, but it was only if he was careful where he hid his stuff and made sure his robotic eye was covered with a patch he made from his ratty old clothes, which would warn Robotnik what he was up to. All he needed to do was to pick his way out and do it.
11111112.title: A couple years go by...

choices: Landing Bay

111111122.content:
Eric was trapped in one of his usual mazes, with robotic dogs biting at his heels and electric fences guiding him through it, it was barely more than a simple challenge of speed more than anything. He knew that the two of his handlers were watching him, taking notes as they sent more at him. Everything seemed normal as it was to run through an all metal maze to the possiblity of being teared apart by vicious robot mutts, but somewhere else, things were less than normal...

*****

"Take cover!" A squirrel shouted loudly to a blue walrus before they all dropped to the ground as laser fire coated the wall behind them, quickly ducking behind a low wall as they were pinned down by enemy robot fire. Older animals took shots at Swatbots and other robots as they moved towards a generator that power half the city.

"Quick, plant it Sally and get out of here!" An older eagle yelled before he was hit and dropped like a stone paralyzed as others moved to cover his end. The squirrel pulled out a small box from her pack and placed it by the generator as everyone started to run for the exit.

Sally ran as hard as she could but she could not help but see her friends slowly taken away by Robots as they neared the end of the range of the blast radius. Her friend stood by and helped her fight back against outstretched claws and hooks towards them, just when she hit the trigger and watched the world light up within seconds before the building they fled from exploded, blasting out windows and crumbled the roof as buildings around slowly turned off from the lack of electricity, including the main base of Robotnik.

"Nice job Sal!" A walrus congratulated Sally as she counted the remaining friends they had left and realized that more than half were taken, leaving only a few older than them fighting. "Now that metalhead is stuck in the dark."

"It's not a victory. We lost too many." Sally shook her head as she disliked her role as leader, knowing she would always fail her friends and fighters in some way.

"We'll get them back." The Walrus stated with crossed arms, staring back at the tower where their hated enemy slept. "One day."

*****

"He seems to be doing well sir, his endurance and strength have grown as we test him." Snively told Robotnik as they watched over the maze where the blue fox fought through traps as he made his way.

"How soon until we start the Phase 2?" Robotnik asked without looking away from his future weapon.

Snively took a few moments before he carefully explained to his master what troubled him. "He has been very resistant to obey, at most, he needs to be 're-orientated' before we even begin with the next phase."

"That isn't what I wanted to hear-" Robotnik didn't look pleased as he started to comment but was interupted by the power going out everywhere. "Snively! What is the meaning of this?!"

"The power seems to have been cut, one of our plants must've been hit by those troublesome rebels."

Robotnik slammed his fist on the console before he face his second in command with a face of hate. "Those brats! Send teams to fix the problem, now! And make sure that brat down there cannot get out!" Robotnik pointed to the maze Eric was in, who was at the end of the maze but the power out made him confused, getting Snively to salute to Robotnik.

"Yes sir!"

*****

Eric quickly knocked out the dogs as they were easier to stop without him being watched and stunned if he touched them. Yet it was nearly impossible for anyone to see him as he slipped out the door of the maze, little more than a sliding door without power to magnetically seal it. He quickly ducked out of the room after picking the lock, watching the platform where Snively was trying to find Eric's movement with little luck.

He knew that he had two options to escape, one was to break out through the landing bay, which had a way from him to the city he once knew. The other had him sneak out through one of the exits, hopefully avoiding all of the robots who were programed to take him in at once on sight. Both had their risks and both could possibly end with him back in his cell with broken ribs, but he had to take a chance and he quickly decided towards...
111111122.title: A Rare Fluke, Eric Breaks Free!

choices: Dumped the fuel and prepared to abandon ship
Ducked under the dashboard to hack into the mainframe
1111111221.content:
Eric remembered the landing bay to be quiet, from his last couple of attempts to get free, as it mostly held transports of drones and robots to factories or to the streets, just where he wanted to go. He moved himself in the shadows around patrols which were stirred up in search of him, careful to use his knowledge from his exercises to keep his wits sharper than a razer. Eric stopped in front of the door to the bay after a few close calls and a good amount of stealth, careful to keep to the side in case someone looked in from down the hall.

"Hmm, this thing is heavy."

Eric commented as he looked at the double door, which was several times taller than him. It would be easy to unlock, but the noise of him opening it would get him in trouble. Yet his ears told him of another way as he quickly climbed up onto the ceiling just as two Swatbots were coming through, glad he was able to find grips and footholds to grasp on. He then tried to think of a way to get them to open the door when suddenly the intercom sparked to life.

"Swatbots! Converge on the area! Get me those hedgehogs!

Immediately the two bots perked up as they went past the door to the bay, but the door opened from the inside and several Swatbots poured out, unaware the blue fox who took his chance. He then climbed high in the room to see everything in the landing bay from the highest corner, waving off spiderwebs.

From his spot, Eric could see the entire bay and each vehicle and robot working there. The bay had several vehicles for him to get away in, but without a proper set of keys, he would be stuck. His first thought was to be a stowaway in a transport, but once he saw the scanners bots screening the cargo for organic life, he dropped it and settled for stealing an airship. Of course, he didn't necessarily knew how to drive one, so he hoped it was as simple as pushing a button and it went off. Yet Eric spotted a drone which had the key while it typed away in a terminal, so he quietly climbed above the machine and swiped it which was nothing more than a keycard. He then climbed back up just when the drone turned to look around, yet returned to it's work after a while.

Eric let out a soft sigh before he examined the keycard and saw it had which he looked towards the ships to find it, stopping at a ship which had the number on the wing. It was a cargo transport which some drones were finished loading barrels into it, yet he couldn't tell what it was other than black tar when one robot accidently spilled one. Eric was a little unsure what they needed black tar for but shook it off and slowly moved to where he was above the ship, which was a decent size better than the others. Just as he was about to drop down, Eric spotted four forms by a ship that were definitely not robots, as one was a mouse and the other three were pink, green and blue hedgehogs.

Eric felt his heart soar as he had rarely seen normal creatures other than metalheads and his overseers for years, wanting to yell and get their attention, but he knew they were hiding from trouble like he was. He couldn't hear what they were saying but the mouse ran off to another ship as the three tried to unlock the ship, with the green one slipping something into the lock before it opened for them, then the green hedgehog gestured them inside.

The fact they were something that pissed off Robotnik made Eric happy as they were someone he could go to once he was free. Suddenly he saw their ship power on and he quickly dropped onto his own and got inside as their plan to get out would help him get away with less heat. He waited all of a few minutes after their mouse friend caught the Swatbot's attention as he sped away, before he glanced at the dashboard and suddenly felt really stupid.

In front of him, Eric saw several glowing buttons and levers that had no labels and not even pads in the floor to press that he remembered his father's car had. Eric braved a button and found it turned on the wipers to the windshield, quickly turning it off before he hit another that turned on the headlights. "Damn it! How do you start this thing?" Eric cursed as he kicked the dashboard before slamming a large button, surprised when he felt like something was lifting before he realized he had hit the bottom thrusters. He then felt around and saw a switch that showed speed, quickly moving it to normal speed before he felt himself fall back as the ship headed through the gates and out into the open sky.

Eric whooped with joy before he got up and grabbed what look like a wheel that seemed to control the direction of the ship, moving away from Robotnik's tower and more towards what he remembered as Mobotropolis. His stunt with messing around with the dashboard had made him lose sight of the hedgehogs or the mouse's ships, making Eric annoyed. He flew over Downtown and was shocked by the amount of polution and metalwork that seemed to cover the town as he went by, realizing how much had changed in the years he had as a prisoner.

His thoughts were interupted as he hear a deep robotic voice through what he assumed was the intercom. "TB7-HD9-6N3! You are off course, return to base immediately!" Eric quickly realized the booming baritone was of Robotnik, and pressed the talk button before he yelled into the mic directly from his rage.

"No way fatso!" Eric screamed into the mic before a screen flashed and a confused but quickly angered image of Robotnik appeared.

"Prower! You stole my fuelship?! How dare you!" Robotnik barked and pointed at Eric but somehow he didn't seem too upset after a few minutes. "Hmm, you think you are out of my reach? Did you forget you are in my ship? I have control!" The rotund tyrant then laughed before the ship suddenly lurched and went in a different direction, right into a tall glass windowed skyscraper. "If you beg for forgiveness, and I will spare your life and theirs. If not, I can afford to lose you and the rest!"

Eric quickly put his robotic fist into the screen as he was never going to be Robotnik's puppet again, never to beg or pled for anything anymore. He then took his hand out and gripped the steering wheel and pulled with all of his might to turn it, yet it seemed like he was doing nothing as he started to see people inside the buildings windows from turned on lights. His robotic eye quickly estimated that the collision would effectively level the top of the building as well as kill him and the hundreds if not thousands of people inside judging by the high number of fuel barrels in storage. Eric came to the conclusion that he had two options, both risked his life and others but not to the number the collision would if he did not act, just as fighter ships followed on his tail.

Option one was that he was dump all fuel tanks and hope for the best as the toll would be less although the damage would be done as he would bail out on a nearby rooftop. From there, Eric would flee into the building and avoid the fighter airships that would end his life quickly. The second option was to break the override that Robotnik had and steer away from the building, even though that would not give him enough time to escape the fireball that the ship trapped him in once it crashed, as any body of water was far away and only the concrete jungle was available. 11111112211.content:
Eric frantically flipped switches and knobs to open the cargo door, yet nothing happened, as he was still locked out of the dash. He glanced back through the cabin at the back door and went to it as he would have to do it manually, kicking down the door as he ran past the cylinders full of fuel. Each one he passed by made him feel panic build in what was left of his chest, yet he held his nerve until he reached the cargo door.

The door was designed to prevent anyone from easily getting inside. With several inches of soild steel, reinforced to weathering and heat, most would be stuck. Yet Eric was more progmatic, even when he turned the manual switch and found it did nothing. He traced a hand along the wall, trying to find where the wall was thin and gave way to some pressure. That was easier done when the ship wasn't rocked hard after another hit from the fireships, momentarily losing the spot before he rushed and found it again. He dialed into his arm's interface and prepared it to deal with the task ahead, feeling it extend the shock absorber before he hammered his metal fist into the weak point over and over. At first it seemed like nothing happened but the ring of metal on metal, but dents built up and a hole formed, where he peeled away the wall until the gale forces ripped it from the hull. The gales stormed strong as he went back to the front of the canisters and kicked, shoved and tossed each toward the open door in a mad rush to lessen the effects of the crash that was closer and closer each second.

Eric had managed half of the barrels before he spotted a missle soaring towards his ship again, making he panic as it soared by and hit the side of the ship again, knocking him off his feet. He heard warning whines from the bridge and felt the whines of metal barely holding on as he knew that it was his last clance to leave, hoping he made a difference. He ran to the open hatch, dialing his metal hand to a hook in case he needed to anchor fast from becoming a stain on the road before he looked at his options. His robot eye was displaying calculations of his survival, which was low wifh a high chance of breaking both his neck and anything else that hit first, but a soild hundred percent chance of him dying if he stayed on the ship.

Eric took a breath before he jumped, trying to grab onto a roof with his wildly flailing arms and legs, wishing he had a shorter jump distance from the ship to the roofs. He first fell stomach first on the stone railing edge of a roof, knocking the air out of him, but thankful he caught himself. "Up and over... before I..." It wasn't untill after he wedged his foot in the stone to climb over that it broke, making him lose his grip and dropping him yet again with his eyes wide with shock as he screamed obscenities through the descent. The landing sucked as he fell hard on his side although in something surprisingly soft and absolutely disgustingly scented. He slowly opened his eyes to find himself deep in a dumpster, resting on nearly three-dozen bags of trash and food waste, although he made sure to check if he was really alive first through gags as he wondered how he survived. "Did I seriously live through a dozen floors distance to soild ground? Maybe my luck is turning around after all..."

Finding no easy answer other than his robot bit blunted the fall, Eric tried to dig his way out of the trash, trying to keep his mind off what he was actually touching as he went. He fell off the edge of the dumpster, rolling over a few bags that were on the ground before he stood up and tried to wipe off as much as he could from his clothes and fur. In the distance, he spotted the damage of the building with his ship leaving a hell of a hole in the side of the building, yet it stood strong with a crowd slowly forming to help those hurt at the base. Eric's expression darkened as he tried to help and vowed to repay Robotnik for the damaged he caused, yet quietly thankful he was not in the wreckage.

His first thought as he walked was a warm shower, a good meal and a clean bed to sleep in away from Robotnik, yet he knew many of those were for the wealth only. So he thought about what he could do and quickly figured he would have to get cleaned up if he wanted to see about a way to get his family back. "I wonder how long it would be to find a working shower out here." He commented as his wiped his hands and sought it out while covering his own nose.

11111112212.content:
Eric quickly ducked under the console before he slammed his robotic fist into the plating to weaken it, peeling it away so he could get to the wiring underneath it. Once he had peeled it away, he looked at the array of circuts and wires, each had a function for the ship and could ultimately change fate. He quickly grabbed a few wires and spilt them open in order to reconnect with other circuts and inputs to disable the lock on the steering wheel. As he worked, he heard the computer interface speak, but he couldn't look up for a second.

"Alert! System is being sabotaged! All hands report to the cockpit!" Alert! System on collision course with existing stucture, please change current course!"

"That's what I want to do! " Eric angrily remarked at the machine as he winced back when sparks came up near his face before continuing his work, yet froze when he heard another alert.

"Alert! System is being locked on by friendly ships! Brace for immediate fire!"

"No! Don't sh-!" Eric tried to yell before he was cut short by a violent shockwave that launched him foreward and slammed his head into the dashboard before he fell to the ground, clutching his head.

"Warning! Critical damage to cargo bay! Tempature rising in Cargo bay!"

"Shit! Fire!" Eric cursed as he then forgot about the guts of the computer system and then tried his hardest to force the wheel with his robotic arm and even kicking it. He knew the second the fire hit the fuel, he would go up in flames like his system warned him, so he put all he could to move the wheel. He was shocked to find the pressure had actually ripped it from postion, dooming Eric as he tried to think of another way out while holding the wheel. That's when he heard feedback from inside his ear, direct from his tactical computer.

"User, analysis of fuel ship collision course has now found a higher chance of survial. Now taking control for precision power!"

Eric felt himself go cold as his green interface turned dark red along his robotic body, until it went up and consumed all of the green, making Eric's exprssion change from fear and anger to blank and emotionless. "Control complete, executing comands." He droned on, all life in his face gone. Eric then walked to the left side window as the dashboard and it's interface barked damged parts of the ship as it took more hits from the other ships. He then pulled back his arm with the wheel in it before he slammed the window with it until it broke open and air ripped through. He then looked back at the wing of the ship and launched the wheel at it with enough force to level a tower, gripping tightly to the ship to brace...

******
Half an hour eariler...

A red panda calmly walked through the front doors of Mobius Express' headquarters, one of the largest inport export businesses that Robotnik left it alone, in exchange for some of the dough. Her short orange heels clicking on the polished floors as she made her way to the front desk, ringing the bell to get the attention of a crocodile reading the paper.

"Hmm?" He said before he folded down the top of his paper to see her young face before he took his feet off the desk and sat upright. "What brings a young lady like yourself here, miss...?"

"I am expected upstairs to see my father. I need a vistor badge." The red panda replied curtly with a distinct accent that the clerk took note of, as well as her expensive eastern dress and suitcase. He also noticed she was barely older than ten years old but held herself as if she was more than twice her age.

"Really? No one told me anything about that..." The crocodile looked doubtful as he couldn't remember any pandas in the building, just when he noticed the black card put on the table with one word 'Dusk' typed on it. Immediately the color drained from his face before he shakily handed her a vistor badge. "S-sorry, I didn't mean to pry, here miss..."

"You should forget I came through." The red panda answered back as she pinned the badge to her waist, staring coldly into his eyes, making the crocodile nod quickly.

"Y-yeah, sure thing kid. I wasn't even here."

The red panda then smiled sweetly like nothing had happened and took the card before she walked away to the elevators, dragging her suitcase with her. The crocodile waited until she went into the elevator before exhaling the breath he had sucked in, holding a hand to his chest.

" I didn't know the assassin's guild took anyone so young, I think I need a holiday..."

******
Minutes before Eric's critical moment

The red panda looked through the scope of a high powered rifle out into the day, using the janitor's closet to her advantage. After getting the janitor out with the sight of her rilfe, all she had to do was cut a hole just big enough so she could aim through to her target. Several dozen blocks away was a skyscrapper with a window showing a particular conference room that held her target. She had three different bullets next to her, as she left her rifle unloaded while she touched the button on her earset, hearing it ring once before a deep voice spoke in her ear. "Yes?"

"I have a problem, the angle has more than half the boardroom facing away from me. At least six are impossible to id."

"That is your problem, not ours. Get it done, or no payment Xin, you know how this works."

"Whatever." The red panda growled before she hit the button again and cancelled the call. She kept looking for a way to distract the boardroom in order to get their attention when she suddenly saw quite a sight to see. Three of Robotink's airships, one fuel ship and two attackships, heading toward her target's building at a high speed. She could see the fuelship was the target as it took a few hits and fires started to appear, making her wonder about her target.

"Hmm, that fuel ship looks like it might do my job for me. However, it never hurts to be prepared." Xin thought as she picked out one of the bullets with her other hand and loaded it into the rifle, keeping an eye on the fuel ship. She then watched has a blue form appears from the window of the fuelship, zooming her len as far as it went to to examine their face. She immediately thought of the Freedom Fighters, a bunch of rebels with ancient equipment trying to take down a tech monster. She shook her head in disgust just when she saw the blue form launch something hard enough to cut one of the wings off the fuel ship.

It immediately dipped downward to the left of the building, the last functioning wing scrapping against the side of the building before it went past. Xin however switched over to her target's window and saw each of the members were staring out the window, and quickly identified her target before she shot him dead. Xin pushed the earset button again as she watched the chaos inside the opposite building as the line connected.

"Is it done?" The same voice asked without any emotion other than impatience.

"Yes."

"The money has been transfered. We will contact you for your next task."

"Understood." Xin stated as she moved the rifle away and started to disassemble it just when she heard a massive explosion. She then used the scope to check around the area and found a huge stack of smoke not too far from the building she was aimed at, most likely the fuelship that went down.

"Another idiot dead, this warzone is prime pickings for someone like me. But I just need enough for back home, my family relies on me." Xin thought coldly as she went back to putting her rifle away, already wondering about where she would go visit next that she hadn't went to already.

111111122122.content:
"Status?" Robotnik barked at his computer as he paced around the chair he usually sat in, waiting for his computer to spit out if Prower was alive or not, feeling already a pit form in his stomach.

"Scanning... Life readings for Eric Prower are fractional, possibly of instantaneous death, 90.8 percent.

"What a pity." Robotnik grimaced before he slammed his fist into the chair arm, somehow feeling regret tickle at him as he reflected. That boy was supposed to be my shadow agent, all that time and money, what a waste. Still, I suppose it's up of me to take down those rebels, as always. Robotnik then pressed a button and Sleet's face along with Scratch's face appeared on the screen, tightening his glove. "It seems like our side project failed, double your efforts on taking down the Hedgehog Trio and focus on Princess Sally. Without him, you both need to compensate for what his actions would've been."

"Not a problem sir, that tin can could never compete with us. I'll take down those punks myself." Sleet bragged proudly but was interupted by Grower, who had butted into Scratch's space.

"Oh yeah? I bet we'll take them down first! We were some of Dr. Robotnik's first creations, we were designed to crush that hedgehog and that fox kid Tails who followed him around."

"Oh please, you're defective hunks of garbage." Sleet insulted the duo, who managed to push both of their faces into the screen, making Robotnik growl as his minions were fighting. "Besides I, even Dingo, know the city better than you. Fighting Sonic in the country side is nothing like urban combat, besides, your tech is outdated."

"ENOUGH!" Robotnik yelled into the microphone, shocking his underlings and making them cover their ears. "Quit wasting my time and go after them, every moment you waste is money I lose! Stop those rebels at any cost, NOW!" He then cut the feeds and when back into his chair, sighing before he turned on the interface. "Computer, remove Prower from the files, and make sure a cleaning crew goes to get his body or whatever is left from the wreckage."

"Action has been accomplished. Eric Prower has been removed from files, tracking software is now disabled as well as heartbeat monitor."

"No point leaving files open for those rebels to see, the last thing I need is someone using the file to take me down or making another Prower." Robotnik thought as he laid back in his chair, considering his failure, rather annoyed it got to this point.

1111111221221.content:
The first thing he heard was the ringing in his ears as he woke up face down on concrete, his eyes not willing to work with him. It was only after coughing up something that tasted of iron before the ringing was replaced with the crackle of flames and the whine of bending metal, and it was at this moment Eric placed himself. He was in a crash and likely an explosion, which is explained why the rest of his body wasn't being responsive and why his ears and head hurt so badly. "Uggh... my head feels like someone split it in half... Got to take it slow..."

Eric managed to open his right eye, but the swelling around it made it hard to see everything, greeted with the scene of piles of scrap metal that used to be his ship, making out the cockpit a few meters ahead of him as well as the tail rotor stuck right into it. He tried to see with his left but it didn't turn on, and with the crunch of glass near his head, he half expected it to be broken. Slowly he tried to pick himself up, only to cry out in pain as his body lit up in agony, cracked bones and deep cuts screamed out along his body, droping him to the cold ground quickly. After managing to breath after the surge of pain, he realized his robotic side was turned off, likely damaged in the crash, unaware what caused the crash other than the other fireships. He quickly stopped moving and tried to find someone to help him, only able to croak out his words. "S-someone...? Please help m-me!"

Eric couldn't find any motion around him, it was as if he dropped into a graveyard, which did not seem right for the city he knew. However his thoughts were interupted when he coughed up again and found he coughed up blood and a lot of it. He looked at his body and found a few large pieces of scrap that were stabbed deep into his fur, making him groan as he turned his body so the pressure was off them, know full well that they were in some of his organs and the warm wettness at them was his blood. "Where is everyone?" Eric thought as he tried to keep from groaning in pain, slowly able to move his normal arm, though he knew it was brusied badly. "You'd think an airship crashing and an explosion would catch some eyes... Damn that hurts... Not to mention a hurt kid bleeding in the street. Damn them... I'll do it myself as always..."

He started to feel very cold as he lifted his arm and dragged his body from it's spot, using his chin to help pull him since his body was too heavy to pick up turned off. Eric tried to avoid from stopping, slowly feeling the world blur to his eyes, know if he did he would have trouble starting again. He honestly didn't know how far he went, maybe a block, maybe two feet before he came to the sight of someone in front of him. Even with his blurred vision, he noted the hooded green robe before seeing a mask that was vibrant with deep shades of red, it's eyes wide, letting Eric see the figure's true eyes which were blue. Eric's first thought was that the figure was going to rob him, as his mother warned him about masked figures, however his eyes looked so peaceful, it swayed him of his fears. He then croaked out the last words he could muster, hoping that whoever in from of him would help, dropping his face to the ground and feeling tears form from his good eye. "P-please, help m-me. I'll do anything... I-I can't go now."

The figure look at the wreck of the airship for a moment before he kneeled down and put a hand to Eric's head before he reached under him and lifted up the broken fox in his arms, watching the boy pass out. The figure check his pulse and moved as fast as his feet let him away from the crash site, not allowing the cyborg boy to die on his watch.
1111111221221.title: Left for dead, saved by a mysterious figure

11111112212211.content:
The world sounded like he was underwater, everything swirling around his head as he tried to understand the basics of his situation. He could hear raised tones and shouting but the words were lost in the blur, feeling himself coughing out something that made his tongue tingle, but the familar feeling required more awareness than he could spare. He attempted to move his fingers and toes and was relieved to feel them work, even his robotic ones, which then alarmed him. "Wait...my power...is restored? Where...am I?" His first thought was that he was back in his room, yet he was on a bed, and it was much too comfortable to be something Robotnik or Sniviely just gave him.

It took him all of his effort to just open his eyes, and was surprised to see himself in a wooden room that was bare of everything but the bed and a chair place in front of him. It had a single candle that illuminated the room, showing no windows and a single door on the far side of the room, much out of his current reach. The covers were up to his neck but he felt bandages wrapped around his chest where the shards of metal were once lodged. "What... What is this? Who put me here? Why did they fix me up?" Eric thought as he saw the diagnostic of his body through a shade of white glass, a cheap substitute but handy none the less, seeing he was at a soild 35% functionality and more than half way closer to pushing up daisies than he was comfortable with.

His ears picked up the voices he heard before, loud and angry and muffled by the door, but it was clear that someone was in a bad mood. He could also hear a softer voice that was a struggle just to register, clearly someone who was not for letting others know their conversations, yet Eric felt like he recognized it somehow. Then he heard a loud slam and what sounded like a lightening bolt before he coughed violently, spitting out over the covers with blood, slowly feeling the world blur as a door burst open and two figure rushed in, his eyes closing against his will...

*******

Eric slowly opened his eyes again to the same hooded figure from before on the street, the green cloak reflecting light of the candle and the mask was illuminated. Eric heard small gasps from the figure before he noticed the blood on the figure's gloves and the pile of bandages next to the chair, realizing that they were his own. The hooded figure dropped a bloody scapel onto the floor, next to a small pile of blood-covered metal shards, wiping the gloves off on a rag.

"For a kid trying not to die, you sink toward the darkness easily." The figure spoke loudly to him, full of strength and authority that made Eric wonder who he was facing. "Since you've been sleeping, I haven't learned your name, why don't you introduce yourself son?"

"You...first...."

"You are a guest in my home, have the respect to honor my wishes." The voice cut sharply, making Eric wince as the figure was not much for backtalking.

"Eric. Eric Prower."

The figure leaned in and rested their chin on their gloves, their blue eyes piercing into Eric's soul. "Tell me Eric, for what reason did you decide to take a fuelship from Robotnik and crash it into the street? You nearly destroyed a whole block with that ship, and several people were injuried by the wreckage."

"It's a long story." Eric looked away from the figure's eyes, thinking that he thought no one was there and was kicking himself that he must seem like a horrible person to this figure.

"Enlighten me. I'm a good listener."

**********

"....And then I saw you and you know what happened beyond that." Eric wrapped up his story, feeling slightly better as for the last few hours he explained everything to the figure, trusting them completely for some odd reason. He slowly felt his body being able to move better as he tried to let himself heal, somehow faster than he or the figure had expected.

"Interesting... that is quite the story. You've certainly dealt with many things for someone barely a decade old. I do have one concern though..." the figure asked as he relit a fresh candle, seeing Eric nod. "You say you have a system in that metal head of yours, where it will take over and you won't have control?"

"Yes...?"

"Would Robotnik have access to that system? Make you do things you don't want to?"

Eric moved his normal hand to scratch an itch on his ear but shook his head slowly. "Not that I know, it mostly comes in whenever I'm close to a life-or-death situation. But after that wreck, I'm not sure that he knows I'm alive..."

The figure then stood up and put a hand to Eric's face, examining his robotic face even though he didn't like to be touched. "I wonder... maybe in time we can see this for fact. For now rest up, I'll have something made for you to eat." The figure then moved to the door putting out the candle on the way over.

"Wait, I told you my name, who are you?" Eric asked, the light from the next room almost blinding him as it streamed of the green cloak of the figure.

"In time, you'll know it by heart, but not now." The figure said as they walked into the light, closing the door slowly behind them. "Rest."

12.content:
"The moon looks so... beautiful... " Eric thought as he looked up into the night sky of Robotropolis, not a care in the world for the first time in 11 years. He had forgotten how much the little things matter once they are taken away by force. Eric remembered how he felt the first time he was shown the moon by his mother Rosemary, how amazed and starstruck he was, like a new world had just be opened to him. The wind brushed against his fur and he almost felt complete again.

And then... it was gone as an image showed in his left eye a call from his master Robotnik waiting impatiently to be answered. Eric frowned and pressed a button on his left arm, before replying in a manner fitting a teenager to a parent. "What?"

"Are you in position Ironfist?" a voice he knew well droned into his ears through his ear pieces.

"Yeah..."

"Do you see the target?"

Eric turned his gaze below him and saw from the skyscraper roof he was on an assortment of small buildings that seemed like nothing but abandoned ruins. He zoomed in his sight with his robotic eye and saw what looked like a small base with armed guards surrounding it. Young and old animals holding weapons with varying degrees of confidence and determination. A base of Freedom Fighters, enemies of Robotnik and lackeys of Princess Sally Acorn.

Ah... Princess Sally...

Sad thing was, Sally Acorn was the only female he had ever seen since he was young. Robotnik wanted no attachments to the outside world that could keep Eric from him. He felt embarrassed as he remembered a few times he used the pictures of Sally on her file in ways the real squirrel wouldn't have liked. Sex drives, highly distracting. Eric was almost caught up in a fantasy of his when he realized Robotnik was waiting for him to respond. "Roger."

"Copy their archives and disable their power source. I will send in Swatbots to round them up for Robotization. Failure is not a option."

"Whatever." Eric then stood on the edge of the roof and jumped with no hesitation.

Wind howled as Eric dropped from the roof, doing nothing to prevent the oblivion rushing up to meet him, parallel to the building as he dropped head first to the ground. He looked at his reflection in the glass windows as he dropped by them, he looked dangerous and a threat to all who stood in his way albeit dirty and uncombed. At the last five stories to the cold merciless ground, Eric spun around and landed on his feet, causing a crater to form under his impact. Yet he brushed off the dirt and dust and quickly walked away from the crater, towards his target, glad he upgraded his flesh leg to robotic so he wouldn't have to hobble to the base with a shattered leg.

Eric felt a little showmanship didn't hurt when he was the quiet bane of all enemies to Robotnik.

***

The base was more complex that Eric expected. Electric fences, state of the art security with time locks and vehicles everywhere, yet everything was disguised as broken junk. Clever. Eric thought as he hid behind a crumbled building across the street to the base. They are adapting, Robotnik will be displeased.

Eric frowned, he could break in given the right tools that he acquired from his childhood practice of thievery, but it would take a large distraction to get attention away from him. He then looked towards the vehicle garage where the guards were very thin and grinned. He sneaked over and broke in, to see that besides the cars were half filled tanks of gasoline, and quickly went over and turned on a blowtorch before setting it facing towards the tanks and their puddle surrounding them.

The fireworks were more then adequate and the shock on the poor fools faces was worth it as their stealth base lit up like a torch.

Eric quickly broken into the database from the generator building far away from the hysterics of putting out the fires. He quickly downloaded everything on it into his files and quickly disabled the generator with ease before stepped out of the base and back into the darkness of the night when the Swatbots arrived.

Just another day at work...
***

Eric walked the streets of Robotroplis in the poorer district, where the people were weak with hunger and survived day by day if they had no money. He knew he needed to get home to Robotnik, but he felt like he earned a quick break and went to...

Just as he put his hands on the edge of a large oil painting of Bartleby that hide the safe, his ears picked up soft footsteps inside the house. "I thought his staff left eariler. Crap, now I need to hide." Eric thought as he scoped out his options. He first thought the closet since it was roomy, yet the idea of being stuck in there was risky, maybe the visitor would go there first, then what could he do? However, he went to the private bathroom and cracked the door before going against the wall, dimming his interface and slowly holding back his breath as not to tip off the figure once it pushed the door open.

Eric could only see what light came into the room from the open window, but it appeared the figure was femmine from the outline, with a spiky hairstyle to boot, and he could barely make out a short cut dress but he wasn't sure. The first thing the figure did was close the window after peeking out at the garden, then she moved towards the bed, just as Eric activated his night vision in his eye. He was surprised to see the girl in the photo was here, Sonia Hedgehog, Sonic's sister. She wore the punk outfit she first had out when she joined up with her brothers years ago, yet she accessorized with different colors and a new dye streak in her hair that looked nice.

Focus! You have a top five priority target in front of you, nab her and bring her to the Master. Lock up that mink while you're at it.

"That's not going to work..." Eric thought back at his programing, frowning as he felt his system try to reach into his controls, trying to go around him. "The job is to find out if Montclair has tides to the Freedom Fighters and to steal his money, she isn't mission critical. Besides, an ex dropping by doesn't mean jack for proof, now quiet!"

He then focused on Sonia and Bartleby at the bed, increasing the sensitivity of his robotic ear while he kept an eye on what they were doing, his eye recording them. It seemed Sonia sat on Bartleby's bed before she shook him away, slowly waking up the pompous mink before he realized who was there. "Sonia! Whatever brings you here... this late?" It seemed his expression was a mix of joy and serious worry, like he did still care for her, but worried about being found with her.

"Hello Bartleby." Sonia greeted her ex with a small smile yet she seemed to have something on her mind, something Eric picked up when she glanced around, not wanting to be heard. " Unfortunately this isn't a social call, I need talk to you about what we talked about before, about helping us."

"Jackpot." Eric thought as he made sure to record Montclair's struggle for the right words, knowing that whatever he said would be at the front of Robotnik before sun up. "Just say yes, and she'll go away, you go to sleep and I go home."

"Sonia, you know how much trouble I could be in if Robotnik found out I helped you?" Bartleby asked nervously, making Eric annoyed as Sonia's ex was trying to see how far she wanted him to go. "I could lose my home, my wine collection, my life with the others! I know I helped you before, but this time I'm not."

"It's just listening in on your friends. They know things that we need to hear about, like when Robotnik holds special events or news about secret projects in planning." Sonia reminded Bartleby as put her hands in his and squeezed them, giving him doe eyes, something that made Eric roll his eyes as he watched them. "Please? It would really mean a lot if you help me..."

Slowly and predictably, Bartleby calmed down and squeezed her hands back before he smiled at Sonia. "I'll do it for you Sonia, I'll tell you about anything I hear that you need." It was at this point Eric stopped the recording, everything he needed was right there, and Robotnik would keep an eye on Bartleby. However, what Sonia said afterwards made him wish he was still recording.

"Thank you!" Sonia kissed his cheek before she got up and went through the door. "Now I'm off to take down one of Robohead's bomb factories, be good Bartleby."

Eric growled quietly as the pink hedgehog was on her way out, seeing the mink slowly drift back to sleep, feeling rather divided. On one hand, he was supposed to complete his mission by steal what was in the safe otherwise Robotnik would not be pleased, but stopping a factory from blowing was an opportunity too good to pass up. He could save the bomb factory, plant a tracker on Sonia and find the freedom base or run into Sally and get in good with his overlord by bringing her back. Eric felt annoyed as he quietly...

Eric hated leaving a job half done, especially since he was itching for some good old fashion theft, but Sonia caught him off guard. He quietly ducked into the hallway, following Sonia's shadow as he opened a window and went through, avoiding being too close to her as she ran off into the city. "Hmm, she could be going anywhere. I want to put a tracker on her, but it's too risky. If she sees my face, then I'm stuck if she shows up again. I need to know where she's going first, then plan for action."

Also like a shadow, he tagged along and followed Sonia's every move, not seen to her as she attempted her little scan in the darkeness. He was worried about the soon coming dawn, even he couldnvt get away easily if they saw his face during a fight. Eventually however, the hedgehog made it to a factory on the other side of town, with Eric on a rooftop overlooking the team set up near it. He counted five Freedom Fighters, Sonia, her brothers Sonic and Manic, a walrus and finally Sally Acorn. Eric's mind lit up like a spotlight, his system almost going off like an alarm as his focus was directed at her, not like he wasn't already scoping her out when he first saw her. She looked good, and immediately he felt the need to control himself, otherwise his focus would not end the way Robotnik intended. He cooled off before he noticed the hedgehog trio was moving towards the plant, immediately struck with the idea with calling in backup.

"I can handle getting Sally, while someone else goes and stops those hedgehogs. Robotnik can lose a plant, having Sally can change his attitude quickly.Hmm, I think it's think to get out the disguise."

He then pull the pack off his back and dug through to find his action clothes, pulling out a hoodie, a mask and some gloves. He liked his mask, it was a version of his master's, the eyes circular and the mouth was a straight line, but the vibrant colors of the lips and checks made him seem like he was wearing artwork. He however didn't enjoy hiding himself by wearing the disguise, he felt like he should know those below him, yet a quick jolt corrected his behavior and he dawned his mask with the hoodie and the gloves. He then scouted what the walrus and Sally were doing and saw they were tapped into the network, providing the trio with assistance. Eric then tapped his interface, pulling up the phonebook and called Sleet, putting his finger to his robotic ear.

"What is it furball?"

"Robotnik's factory in the southwest quadrant is being attacked by the Freedom Fighters. Get Dingo and get over here." Eric frowned as Sleet always got on his nerves, yet he heard a yawn before Sleet responded.

"Deal with it yourself, it's too earily."

Eric rolled his eyes as he went with his go-to way to getting Sleet to do his grunt work, apealing to his greed and ego."Fine, then I guess I'll grab the Hedgehogs myself. And get the credit for nabbing Sally myself."

"What?! Those hedghogs and the princess are in the same place?!"

"Yep, for maybe 15 more minutes at best. It's a shame really, I would be taking all of them in, and your task was to get the hedgehogs, I wonder how the boss man will treat you for not getting the job done. I bet he'll give me a fortune..."

"...We'll be there in 10..."

Eric smirked as he cut off the line, keeping an eye on the two in front of him. Sleet was too stupidly smart for his own good, all he needed was a reason to try and beat Eric at something and that wolf would jump to nab it, not willing to be the loser. In truth, Sleet would have the hedgehogs if he caught them, that was his and Dingo's goal. Eric's mission was Sally Acorn, no matter what, he would get her to Robotnik alive or otherwise. His programing told him to follow this simple intruction and he wasn't going to deviate from the plan, preparing a cloth to knock her out and a gun for the worst case scenario. The challenge was to drag her all the way back home, maybe if he 'borrowed' a ship from Sleet's bunch while they were busy, he could get away easier. Neverless, Eric waited for Sleet to arrive, prepared to snatch the girl and be on his merry way out to retirement.

"No thanks, I think I want to be sharp when we do this." Eric answered as he sat in a very comfortable cushion chair, keeping a hand near his pounch of smoke bombs. He noticed the vast decoration around her office and even a large oil portrait of her and what he assumed were her friends or workers on a large heart bed, yet he didn't see any guys there.

Rouge however poured two glasses full and passed one to Eric while she held one in her hand as she sat down and gave Eric her full attention. "So Prower, what brings a Thief into my house? I hope your master told you better than to steal from your greaters."

"That is not why I am here Rouge." Eric stated clearly as he felt the presence of two forms behind him that made his hardware give off a little warning, leaning in a bit as he still kept his face from Rouge. "I came to you for knowledge, as you hold quite a lot, as well as power.

"I'm on a schedule, be blunt with what you came here to ask." Rouge spoke with a serious tone as she lost the playfulness she was known for and became the business-woman with enough authority to claim superiority to him. "Or my boys will let you out."

"I'm here about an ex partner of yours, I think you know him as Hypon, but his real name is Gris." Eric slurpped his drink and put it down on the desk away from him, at the ready for anything. "You worked in GUN, but somehow he has no crediable file handy about him. I figured you know him best, so I came to you."

"Huh, wonder what he got himself into this time. Sure, I know him, we were partners." Rouge answered back as she spipped her drink, leaving a lipstick mark on the rim of the glass. "What would you like to know?"

Eric leaned foreward as he could barely contain his excitement for a new info source, but went for the most helpful question first. "I want to know what he looks like, his file had no picture, and I assume that will be no trouble for an observant woman like yourself."

Rouge glanced at whoever was behind Eric and waved at them, giving Eric more space as she thought about it. "Well, to an unobservant viewer, he would be a black wolf. Tall, sharp red eyes, killjoy as his face is serious."

"Ok..." Eric said as his system recorded notes and was already working on a possible face, moving on to something more serious. "What do you know about Hypon and Eggman?"

"What are you saying?" Rouge asked curious at his line of questions. "If Hypon is up against the lard man, it's to take him down, the last thing he would do would work for Eggman. I thought he was with those rebel kids, what were their pretend name? Oh yes, 'Freedom Fighters', not really working out for them in terms of freedom right now are they?"

"Alright, what about something called 'Project Ironfist'? Ring any bells?"

Rouge snapped to attention and stood up, making Eric coil up in order to get away faster. "How do you know about that? Hypon was looking into an outfiting project from Eggman, something about a deadly agent in progress. It was years ago, so maybe it already happened. Anything else?"

Eric could tell he was making her annoyed and swallowed his nerves as he asked his last question. "You've seen him in action, how would you rate his combat skills?"

It was that which made Rouge chuckle as she refilled her glass and drank again from it, crossing her legs as she sat down and glancing at Eric. "Against you? He would destroy you. Against me? I would leave him hurt but he might have my number. Against Eggman? Hypon could end him if properly provoked. I would say unless you are hiding more than your face behind that cap." She then gestered the bouncers and Eric felt them pick him up under his arms and held him in place. "My turn, why are you asking questions about my ex partner?"

Eric gritted his teeth as he fought to keep himself in control and blurted out something random. "I'm supposed to steal from him."

"What?" Rouge asked completely taken back from what she thought he would say.

"My task is to steal something he has that a client wants returned. I just want to know what I'm up against! I heard he was a heavy hitter!"

Rouge frowned but took a gun from her drawer and put it against Eric's head, arming it as she was not done with him. "Weird questions for a thief, you are hiding something, speak!"

"That's all!" Eric yelled out.

Rouge took several seconds before she took the gun away from him and sat at her desk again. "Very well, you are excused." As Eric was dragged out, Rouge wondered if she should give Hypon a call and warn him of what the fox boy had in plan for him.

"Nah, this time that wolf is on his own. Serves him for not calling me after he quit, at least a visit would've been nice."

However Eric had less fun as he was tossed into the club's garbage by the bouncers, both sneering at him as they closed the door and locked it, leaving Eric. Eric just sighed before he climbed out and then walked away from the club, his mind buzzing with thoughts too much to smell how bad he was. He got a possible face of Hypon to match existing data in the file, assuming his age and that he didn't get any huge marks from fights. It was more than he had, and for that he was willing to ignore the bouncers and Rouge.

He had a new foe, outside of the box he had already planned for his enemies, one he knew would be trouble if he was already digging into his past. Hypon had to go, and if Eggman was there to see it or if he would be already dead was just a matter of how his new report was to go off. Eric had a balde ready in case, as the fatman was known for his temper as he went back to tell him of the huge leaks and a newer threat.

1213211111112112221222.content:
Club Rouge was a local hotspot the following evening, lines down the block to get in and the floor was packed to the brim with guests all there for fun and a local band that was preparing to play. It was not Eric's kind of plan to sit on a place he was tossed out of, but once he found out a number of people were sitting on the place from the rooftops, he knew someone was making a play. Luckly for Eric, Rouge had put only one bouncer on the backdoor to keep out anyone trying to sneak in, which he was not as effective as Eric only flashed a stolen ID card to get in.

He was wearing a simular outfit to one of the band's staff, a backward purple hat and black shirt that had "Audio Tech, with the band" on both sides as well as red cargo pants and sneakers. Eric had found one of their members about his size and 'persuaded' him not to come in, actually liking the hat which had "Knothole Knuts" proudly displayed on the front, ignoring that the band was friends with one of his hated enemies. He set down a case which had tools of the trade in and quietly went to work on the sound systems as everyone around him were too busy to notice the change in staff, except one bird who went over.

"Hey, who are you? I thought Max was coming." The bird asked, her shirt stated "Stage Manager" and the clipboard in her wing also had a checklist to do before the show, letting Eric know he was refering to a boss.

"Max got sick, I'm his fill in, Mikey." Eric responded confidently, keeping at his work adjusting the the systems until the bird physcially stopped him and stared his down.

"Sick?"

"He had a little too much to drink and made a mess of himself." Eric told the bird with an impatient look, making it seem like he was just trying to to his job. "Look, I just need to do a once through to make sure everything works fine, I just want to get it over with. I won't be any trouble." He knew that the manager was pressed for time as the show was only an hour away, so she might forgive him if the job was done.

The bird however didn't buy his story and held up a radio to security, ready to alert them that something was up. "Max doesn't drink, why are you really here? You got five seconds before I get Rouge's staff to haul you out."

Eric felt himself bit his tongue as he felt like beating the bird for the attitude, but came up with a better approach, hoping not to raise any alerts before his time was up. "Alright, you got me, I'm not here just to fix the systems. I'm also trying to get Songoose's autograph." Eric then pretended to look embarrassed and rubbed the back of his head. "She just so awesome that I asked Max to take his place to ask her for it, but I really do know how everything works. Max was training me to I could join as an intern. I promise I'll do all of Max's work, no charge."

The bird took a few moments before she sighed and lowered the radio, rubbing her feathers. "Ugh, another groupie. Fine, since Max isn't coming, you do it. But if anything goes wrong onstage, your ass is in the fryer, and leave Mina alone until after the show. Now get to work!"

"Yes Ma'am!" Eric answered back before he was back to the system as the bird wandered off to vent her new anger at someone else, watching the area and the audience beyond the curtain with a bit of a smile. He had his place and not one person knew where he was yet. Now all he had to do was lay low and keep an eye out for Hypon, he also planted a few micro cameras around the area as he worked, several just outside the curtain focused on the only hallway to go through to reach Rouge's office. He bent down and pulled out his pistol to silence Hypon with, loading it with bullets before slipping it in the back of his pants and fixing his shirt to hid it, his robot eye already viewing the feeds from the cameras in real time. Then he went over the next system as he actually had to do work in order to blend in, glad he had played around enough with computer systems to know what the hell he was doing.
