"Speak Eric Prower." A voice strong but kind rang out after a short silence from the hooded figure behind the table.

"My Lord, I need a sheet done on me for a mission."

"Why hide from your fellow thieves?"

"If my targets recognize me, or thieves who work for them recognize me, I will be caught and killed."

"You understand this is a serious method, our brothers and sisters will see you as only your disguise, not kin. They will not protect you, they may kill you by themselves, are you sure that you are ready?"

"I...I understand."

The Thief Lord rose from the seat of the desk and walked to Eric's spot, where Eric lowered his head in respect even more. "Very well, from this point on, Ironfist is dead and only Eric Prower will continue in his place until your mission is over.

"Thank you my lord." Eric stated with gratitude as he slowly rose from the ground, turning to leave but was stopped by the hand of the Thief Lord on his shoulder.

"You still haven't given me an answer for before, when we welcomed you back into our fold after Robotic got his hands on you. Yes or No?"

Eric paused for a while before answering with a calm mannerism."Mentor, I am not yet ready for either option. I suspect I may be after my mission, but to answer you now would only prevent the right choice from forming."

"The others are getting restless, they want an answer soon or they will intervene."

"It will come, but not now. Goodbye Mentor." Eric turned and left his master standing in front of the desk, not seeing the frown form under the hood...
1251.title: A talk with an old friend...

choices: The Royal Siblings talk to their passenger
At the drop off point...
12511.content:
Quietly three forms in the moonlight broken into the prison just on the edge of the city, where only the most dangerous of criminals were placed. By distracting the Security Bots, the three made it inside the gates and into the main chamber. Slowly they looked around and grouped together, being cautious of any cameras they hadn't already disabled.

"Remember what we're supposed to do?" A feminine voice asked the two other forms, carefully straightening her designer dress out of dust and fixing her hair back into a rockstar style.

"Yeah, beat 'Botnik butt and save these Mobians." An impatient male voice blurted out as he struggled to keep still as he was itching to go and get back to his dinner. "Can we hurry this up? We just need to disable the power and security, it will take less than a Mobius second."

"Hang on bro." The third figure called out quietly as he held the impatient male in place, this figure also a male but much more calm and patient. "We need to be quiet, no alarms, or the whole place will be impossible to get out. Just chill and take it slow."

"Slow?! Come on, you know I hate being slow."

"We know." Both other figures groaned and rubbed their heads, before the female figure spoke. "We'll go fast on the way back, but we need to make sure we can take them with us. Not everyone can be as fast as you Sonic, we'll leave with more hurt than safe."

"Alright... but I don't like this. It seems weird with Egghead putting so many low crime offenders in a maximum security prison with the truly hardened monsters. It's like he wants them to suffer, and wants us to step in ." Sonic softly wondered as they started to walk quietly past guards while hiding behind crates, working their way to the main control center of the prison.

*****

Eric was in sleep mode until he heard footsteps that didn't sound like robots and immediately got up and went to his bars. He just caught a view of three hedgehogs, one of which he recognized right off the bat as Sonic and the other two looked like his siblings that he worked with in the Underground. Eric's robotic side immediately tried to reach out and grab them but they moved too quick past him and only the green hedgehog turned to see him before going back to his cell.

"Hang on, we'll get you out soon man, just wait a little longer!" The green hedgehog that Eric then recognized as Manic promised as with a confident smile before following after his siblings.

Eric had to breath once they were far enough away, his body kicking into overdrive as he realized that he had three high priority targets right in front of him and they were the Hedgehog Trio. His robotic side was nearly begging him to take them in and to forget the whole mission as they were literally the second highest targets on his capture list. But he had a goal, all must fall, and even though it hurt him to pass up on taking them down now, he had to take down Sally and everyone else too. He just had to hide under their noses and wait patiently.

His time would come, and he will make all of his enemies crumble before him. With Robotnik's head, right under his boot...

*****

"Almost there." Sonia, Sonic's sister stated to her brothers, who were disabling the robot maintenance staff in charge of keeping everything in place and working. "Security is down and the alarm is cut, but the power is a different problem."

"What's wrong?" Manic asked after ripping the head of a Swatbot who was supposed to guard the maintenance team.

"It seems like this place shares power with half of Mobotrobolis, it links here from several junctions. The second we drop the power here, every Swatbot in town will come right at the door."

"That's not good, can't we just reroute all building power to the link out to the city?"

"We could try, but it will be fixed by the main power generators here in a little over a few minutes. We'd need everyone to get everyone ready to run for the main exit once it goes. Manic, go look through the least dangerous criminals here in the records and find their cells releases. Sonic, go tell Sally we need every transport she has ready, we're almost ready to go."

"You got it sis." Sonic nodded before calling Sally from his headset. "Hey Sal, get every transport you managed ready, we're about to blow this popsicle stand."

*****

Eric drummed his fingers along the floor of his cell as he waited for the three to figure out who were going to be saved or not. Suddenly the power went out in cells across from his and soon his own was dark, yet it seemed it was only few dozen in his district were getting out. Without hesitation, he kicked the cell door open and yelled out to the confused prisoners. "FOR FREEDOM!" The prisoners took a second before hollering back his words and then charged to the exit, with Eric following close behind.

It always amazed Eric how simple it was to inspire hope in people.

Suddenly on his left were the hedgehogs who were guiding everyone out into the outside of the walls that imprisoned them. Eric felt his body try to take over and grab them but he held his own, he wasn't going break his cover yet so he instead made it to a pat on the shoulder to the nearest hedgehog, which was Sonia. "You have a plan for getting us away safe, right?" He asked over the roars of the prisoners and was answered in a nod as they made it out into the outside world. He could see the sunrise starting over the horizon, with several cars and hover vehicles waiting inside the gate to take them all away.

Eric paused as he watched dozens of Mobians pack into anything that would get them to safety, standing still in the middle of the chaos as Swatbots were shooting from inside the prison out at them, hitting vehicles and people with ray bursts. He felt conflicted as he was literally in a war zone, a place he had never experienced, until someone grabbed his left arm and tugged him away.

Eric tried to thrash but stopped once he realized it was Manic who was directing him to their van on the side with the lowest resistance for the getaway. Quickly Manic pulled him into it, before shutting the door and sitting in the passenger seat as the van zoomed off from the prison. He could see through the windows that the transports had nearly gotten everyone away safe, and just one had been grounded and was captured.

"Not bad for unorganized rebels..." Eric thought as he steadied himself with the van's jerks and bumps, glancing at the Trio who were celebrating a well done mission. "I have a feeling my work is cut out for me on this job..."
12511.title: A planned escape...

choices: When they stop
He gets a call from Robotnik...
125111.content:
"Way to go, we sure showed those bots!" Manic smiled along with his siblings as they celebrated a good mission, yet noticed their passenger was much more serious as he stare out the window. He gently leaned into his brother Sonic and whispered to him. "Yo Sonic, is it me or is that guy a little too serious? I mean, we did just break him out of prison, the least he could do is say thanks..."

"Chill Manic, he probably noticed not everyone got out. Maybe he had some friends in the prison, don't judge too quick." Sonic spoke softly before finishing his now breakfast of two chili dogs, and then patting his stomach. "Hey Buddy, are you hungry? We have some leftover snacks or some water if your thirsty." Sonic asked as he got up and went over to where their passenger was sitting on the van's floor, holding a energy bar and a bottled water out to him.

"Thanks." The brown fox nodded as he took the water but left the bar and drank it quickly, looking around slightly. "I would've been stuck in that prison for the rest of my life if you hadn't come, all of you. I don't have much, but I hope thank you will do."

"Sure, we're all just doing our job. Say, what were you in for...?" Sonia asked while she drove the van, glancing slightly at the brown fox as he looked a little rough with his half robotized body. She noticed he flinched slightly before he answered her and took note of that.

"I was trying to lift one of Robotnik's gold statues to sell like one of the legends of the Thieves Guild, Golden Beetle. I almost got away until I... triggered a motion sensor..."

Manic felt himself snicker before laughing. "A motion detector? You must be new to the game, any vetted thief disarms one in the first lesson."

"Manic..." Sonia spoke with a sharp tone that made Manic cut the laughter.

"I'm good at lifting wallets and jewelry, I just got careless and cocky." The brown fox frowned at Manic, turning to face the window.

"What's your name?" Sonic asked the fox as he saw past the metal shell, seeing the man inside like he saw the woman in Bunny the Rabbot when she struggled with her change.

"Eric." The fox said before he raised a hand up to shake Sonic's and saw the smile on the hedgehog's face.

"Sonic. That's my brother Manic and Sonia my sister. We're all part of the Underground and the Resistance."

"Wait, so your Freedom Fighters? Some of the guys in the prison spoke about your group and how your willing to fight that tyrant Robotnik."

"That's us." Sonia answered as her brothers nodded and glanced at the map beside her. "It looks like we're going to be a while from the drop off point, why don't you sleep in the back compartment Eric? It won't be safe until we get there, with all Swatbots out there looking for any prisioners.

Eric slowly nodded and watched Sonic sit back with his siblings before he got up and placed something just under a discarded empty bag of chips before he went to the back of the van and went to the lower bunk after closing the door to the rest of the van. Eric then activated the bug he put down and listened from his left ear to the other side of the van.

"He seems alright for a prisoner and thief. How long did you say he was in for Manic?" He heard Sonia's feminine voice over the bumps of the van.

"Only three months, but he was right about his sentence, live without parole for one gold statue of 'Botnik. He seems familiar, I think I saw him before." Eric felt his heart drop as he remembered Manic's past of thievery, and having contact with some of his eyes in the guild and realized his cover might be blown.

"He didn't seem to know you, or any of us. Maybe he was just a face you remember seeing in the crowd..." Sonic quietly come to his rescue and made Manic chuckle slightly.

"Maybe, I could've stolen his wallet when I had my skills and remembered his face when he realized it was gone..."

"Manic..."

"Chill sis, only joking..."

Eric exhaled and turned off the bug to his ear as after that they spoke about the past that he already memorized. He however recorded it in case the fat man wanted to fact check and laid back on the bunk to get some rest. Now he had some trust in them, he was going to put it to the test when they stopped, asking the question that only the serious about the Resistance would ask.
125111.title: The Royal Siblings talk to their passenger

choices: A week goes by...
Back at the training center for new recruits...
1251111.content:
It took a little while, but the van finally stopped outside the forest miles away from Mobotrobolis. Sonia put the van into park and spoke into a radio to Manic, who was on the turret on top. "See anyone?"

"Nope, it's all quiet."

Sonia nodded to Sonic before she got up and went to the back of the van where their guest was probably sleeping, Sonic taking her place at the wheel. She opened the door to find the fox sleeping on his stomach on the lower bunk, looking almost peaceful except for his prison uniform that made her cautious. Sonia gently nudged his shoulder to wake him up, surprised when he nearly jump-started awake and sat up quickly. "We're all at the drop off, time to let you go."

Eric yawned and rubbed his eye as he let his robotic side start up and bring effective power to everywhere. "Alright." Slowly he followed after Sonia as she lead him to the outside, breathing in the air as he faced her with his back to the forest while the van blocked the sun already high in the sky behind her. "So... Sonia, I know I'm not the best of skill but... is it possible that I could join the Freedom Fighters?"

His question seemed to shock her as she took a few minutes to respond. "You a Freedom Fighter? Eric, I don't know enough about you to give you a good answer. You would need to take tests, pass our written exams, give a full history, and even then you need approval from a current member. With your current skills... I don't think you will pass..."

"It's not like I'm going anywhere..." Eric answered back with a serious look. "I don't have anyone or anything to go to and you saw how I'm doing alone. All I ask is that you consider it if I went and tried. I just want people who will have my back when things get bad, like Manic did when the prison yard became a war-zone."

"Eric that's half the reason why I'm not sure." Sonia frown and put her hands on her hips. "A good fighter needs to be able to handle a battlefield. You froze up at the sight of it, which means you haven't had any serious combat. The last thing the Princess wants is Freedom Fighters who flinch at fighting and can't handle themselves. "

"I was unprepared, give me time and I will come back a different fox." Eric spoke defensively, crossing his arms stubbornly. "I just need to know where to go and a chance. Please Sonia, I just want to try..."

Sonia and Eric stood quietly for almost a solid five minutes, making Eric nervous that he was pressing too hard and would lose her. Yet he felt relief when Sonia sighed and gave him a start and blunt answer. "One chance, and you will see how difficult it is. Go back to Mobotrobolis and go to the north section of the city, and wander toward the abandoned slums. You'll be stopped by a patrol and tell them that I sent you to get tested." Sonia then gripped Eric's shoulder and gave him a stare. "This does not mean I support your recruitment, it just means you were noticed. Impress the judges and you'll get in if you make the cut. Now I need to go with my brothers. Take care."

Eric watched Sonia walked back to the van before her two brothers gestured goodbye to him, he was silently admiring Sonia from behind as she stepped in and the van drove off. Eric knew he had no chance, but he had to get his material from somewhere and he was broke. "Hmm, not what I had hoped for. At least I know where to go but without a recommendation, I'll fall flat on my face at the end. I got to get my name out there somehow... get some members interested."

He personally didn't care about the tests, he was treated to the worst of his own with the doctor, surely the Freedom Fighters wouldn't meet up to that intensity. With his false history memorized, he just had to do some kind hearted and nearly suicidal task against Robotnik in order to get the rebels to accept him. He worried that the thieves might remember him if he went too high, so he just thought about normal standards for beginners. He did notice a hint of truth in Sonia's evaluation of his fighting prowess, as his fight were all silent and never went to a real battle, he was at a disadvantage, something he would correct in the passing days. Eric shrugged at himself and walked back the way to the city he enforced for the fat man, ready to crack some skulls.
1251111.title: When they stop

choices: Sally Acorn and Sonia Hedgehog
A mysterious figure in the shadows
12511111.content:
Eric had done what he set out to do, he had become known. In the South and the West of the Mobotrobolis, he was known as Flint, a crime fighter who fought Robotnik at every turn. Starting every single fight with "You work for Robotnik?" or "You picked the wrong day chump" Eric turned himself into a know phenomenon, the opposite of his past as a shadow agent even to his attempts to lessen his renown. He now was recognized on the street as Flint regularly, which annoyed him greatly as it reminded him of being scolded by his mother when she used his middle name.

After a week of cracking faces and saving kids, much easier than Eric had imagined, he got a single letter from the Freedom Fighters to his makeshift home on the street. In the letter was a recruitment offer and restated the info Sonia had shared with him eariler to go to their center. So at the crack of dawn, Eric set out to the center in the north of Mobotrobolis to become his enemy, a Freedom Fighter. The irony was not lost on him.

He stood in front of yet another ruin of buildings that fell into disrepair but were hiding the secrets of the rebels. Eric's robot eye already saw the ambush planned in front of him with fighters hiding in the garbage to pounce him, yet he knew he still needed to seem newish, so he just readied his pistol he got from his crime fighting and went ahead like he didn't already spot the main base. The attack was swift and quickly Eric was without his gun and forced to the ground as a grey wolf with a scar spoke to him. "That wasn't as impressive as you claim you are Flint."

"I actually didn't say I was, I just implied it. Now can we cut knocking me down a peg for your new guards and sign me up already?" Eric asked before he felt himself be blindfolded and pushed into the direction of the main building, rolling his eye as they truely expected him to be that weak. He was dragged into many scanners and searched uncomfortably well for weapons even though all of his body was a weapon. Eventually, he was forced to sit and the cloth was removed where he could see an interrogation room one-sided mirror facing him as he sat at a table.

Eric just watched the mirror as he could see behind it with his robotic eye and saw...
12511111.title: A week goes by...

choices: Later, Eric wakes up in an old situation
Eric wakes up to a dark room
125111111.content:
Eric felt his heart go into overdrive as he saw both Sonia Hedgehog and Sally Acorn staring at him from the one sided mirror. For a brief moment, Eric felt himself blush as he saw the real woman that was Sally Acorn, Princess of Mobius, but quickly dropped it from his face in case they noticed. Still, her pictures had nothing on the real squirrel and Eric felt his hormones trying to start up again, only to be suppressed by his robotic side which kicked in. He needed to focus, and after a few quick pictures from his robot eye, he was able to focus on their lips to try and read what they were saying about him. The pictures would wait until later.

"Kinda small... I mean... with the rumors, I expected him to be more than this..." Sally spoke, which hit Eric a little hard as he was being dimissed by the woman he idolized. Yet he switched to Sonia, knowing he'd prove himself to her later, and maybe do something with her before or after she was locked up for the rest of her life by Robotnik.

"But he has gotten better, remember when I first told you his story about getting locked up, you barely glanced at his report. Yet you're here now." Eric read from Sonia's lips and took note, as she had a valid point, knowing she had to see something in him.

"Believe me, I'd rather deal with Sonic than be here. Yet our latest recruits have been so disapointing, this one will hopefully have some merit to his bragging. Juse look at his robitic side, I doubt he could keep up with our tests, let alone the psychological test. He isn't worth our time, Robotnik needs to be stopped soon, not in ten yeas when he is ready." Sally spoke coldly and Eric was brought into a frown, losing his patience with the brat of a princess who was judging him so harshly, making note of his anger for when he would be alone with her.

"I already support his recruitment Sally, you know we need to go through the motions or we won't know anything. Manic and Sonic want him to try."

Eric watched Sally stare at him and slowly made it obvious he was staring right at her eyes, making her flinch slightly at how cold his glare was. "Fine, but start with the psychological test first, we don't need any more crazy agents than we have already. Get the equipment ready to scan him and I'll go ready a chamber." Sally spoke as she walked out, leaving Sonia with the tech recording the room Eric was in. Sonia took a moment and typed something into a computer before Eric was snapped out of his gaze.

Eric knew what they were up to as he saw the beam of light target him and suddenly his mind went blank as he went through his entire life and every one of his emotions before blacking out and falling to the ground with a thud...

Sonia watched as some fighters went in and picked him up before dragging him away to his chamber, wondering how it was all going to go down....
125111111.title: Sally Acorn and Sonia Hedgehog

choices: " I don't want to talk about it."
Eric buries his words and remains silent.
1251111111.content:
Eric slowly woke up on a hardwood floor as he wiped away some drool he had before he looked around and saw he was in his old room. Eric tried to remember what he was doing beforehand but it came out fuzzy as he realized he was holding something, which turned out to be his old clock. Confused, Eric looked at his mirror in his room and saw his old self, a complete blue fox kid who looked a little quiet but had a shine in his eyes. He admired himself before he saw his old bird friends Copper, Lead and Nickel chirping pleasantly at him and felt happy to see them after so long, hearing their musical chimes. Eric then went to his clock and put it back on his dresser, seeing his room made him content and relaxed.

Then things came into motion...

Eric heard a loud scream, and was snapped out of his nostalgia as his mind cleared and he remembered this fateful day. Without hesitation he went to the window, seeing the events of his kidhood play out in front of him, with his parents being loaded onto ships and sent away as Robotnik and his assistant Snively stood out and barked commands. He saw how motionless his parents were as they were shoved into the ships and ducked under the window, hoping not to be found.

"Ha, the Great General Amadeus and his wife, they will be proud trophies for my citizens to see. If memory serves, he should have two sons in the house. Find them and bring them out here, alive." Robotnik demanded his Swatbots and immediately they went into the house. Eric took all of his will to calm down as he knew that they would find him and take him away, knowing now that what the Freedom Fighters had done to him was to test his psychological state. He hoped he had put up enough barriers to stop them but whatever they gave him was affecting him badly. Eric turned to face the door but found something that scared him more than anything...

Tails was in the house, in his bed, asleep.

"No... you... you weren't here..." Eric froze in horror as he saw his orange little brother resting peacefully in his bed, unaware to the world. "You got away, Sonic and Sally, they saved your life... you can't be here!" He tried to reason with his situation just as a pair of Swatbots came in to get them. Again his birds were killed but they protected Tails and not Eric as both boys were dragged out to the madman, Tails thrashing to get away as the Swatbot held him by the neck.

"Ah, there you both are." Robotnik spoke pleased as his bots stood the Prower's in front of him, walking up to Eric with a smile. "You must be Eric and he must be Miles. I am Dr. Julian Robotnik, and you both are now part of my army as well as your little parents."

"Army? What happened to King Acorn?" Tails asked with fear, trying to loosen the grip on his neck.

Robotnik only smiled before he spoke to Tails, amusing himself. "Deceased, I killed him. Which makes me King of Mobius, and as subjects, you must surrender to my wishes, so BOW!" Immediately the Swatbots who held them released them but instead they and all other bots trained lasers onto them. Eric was confused as this didn't seem right with his memory, yet he knocked to the ground with a hit to his gut, hardly able to breath. Yet Tails, only a few years younger, stood tall to Robotnik and crossed his arms.

"Wait, Tails just do it!" Eric gasped out to his brother, gripping his stomach as he was kneeling on the green grass of their lawn, seeing the lasers aim directly at his brother and worried for him. "It's not worth dying over! Just do it! Please!" Eric then saw Tail look at him and shake his head before he looked back at Robotnik, displaying such strength Eric felt proud.

"Eh, suite yourself kid." Robotnik spoke calmly before he went over to Tails, grabbed him by the neck and broke it with a flick of his wrist. "I don't need rebels, only obedience." Robotnik then flicked Tails' body to the side of Eric and faced Eric with such cold and calculating eyes.

Eric felt his eyes water with tears and he saw Tails laying on the ground, motionless and felt something deep inside his body like he was on fire on the inside. Eric wept for his brother, for his birds and for his parents before Robotnik knelt to his face.

"You will obey me, until you die, not matter where or when. I am your master. I own you and you will always be mine. Now obey me Eric Prower!"

Eric tried to look away but felt the burn of his body again as his body robotized again in a flash, making him gasp again for breath his his body started to go numb as the fire inside him surged out into each limb...

"My every command is your structure! My enemies are your enemies! You live to serve me, and doing so will complete you! You are obedient, you will always obey me. You are no rebel. You're nothing but a boy."

Eric saw a screwdriver fall out of Tails' cold hand, his first one that he had for so long, and felt his own hand grab it slowly without his command.

"A boy does nothing but obeys, he is a slave to himself, just as you are. You obey whoever commands you, a real man, would never do this. A man chooses, a slave obeys..."

Eric felt his visor blur, his eyes go red as he gripped the screwdriver in his hand, seeing blood in the world around him, his body acting for him, making him obey.

"What will you ever choose to do?"

"I'LL KILL YOU!" Eric screamed as he dug the screwdriver deep into Robotnik's head over and over, his blood lust unquenchable and his mind long gone. "I WILL END YOU, YOU OLD MONSTER! DIE! DIE! DIE!" Eric continued until the screwdriver snapped in the head of Robotnik, the man laying on his back in a pool of blood, staring out into the distance with his evil grin. Eric breathed hard as he found himself alone at his home with the body as he realized the eyes were focused on him with piercing joy. He could see the lips move to make out words he would never forget for the rest of his life.

"You will never be complete again, you will die alone, in the darkness of a great threat. You are a failure, destined to destroy everything you touch, ruin the lives of all you hold dear. You are weak, and I have only manifested your toxicity, not created it. You will end your life with disgrace to your family name."

Eric tried to make the words go away as they bounced through his skull, causing him pain as he felt a white light blind him as he fell for seemingly an eternity...

***********************

Eric came to the same blinding light as he started to hear a buzz before words seemed to bounce around above him, like someone was talking.

"Flint, Flint are you alright?"

The voice sounded feminine, and had heavy accounts of worry and something new... fear..? Eric tried his best to sit up but his body was fighting him, as well as a soft hand pressing what little progress upward he managed down. He saw the hand and then his eyes slowly adjusted to the light as he saw the face of Sonia above him, trying to remain neutral but something clearly was eating at her.

"Sonia? What... what happened?" He croaked out at her, making her move away suddenly, which he took note of.

"You said somethings in the chamber we put you in... you have more than a little baggage and scars than you let on..." Sonia then held his hand, looking him straight in the eyes. "You lost someone dear to you, and you blame yourself, and you are out for vengeance."



Eric took a long while to answer Sonia and when he did, he did so with as much restrain as he could manage...
1251111111.title: The Rage

choices: Eric awakes in a misty room
Eric is awakened by an unfamiliar face
12511111111.content:
"I don't want to talk about it." Eric growled as he pulled his hand away and turned his body away from Sonia, making her sad but she only patted his arm and stood up. "Fine, you should know that you failed the test, since your leveled the chamber we placed you in. Do with that as you will, just be prepared to leave once your recover." Sonia then got up from his bed and walked out to the hall, leaving Eric to brood.

"I failed..." Eric spoke quietly as he laid on his bed, thinking on his actions. He didn't even get to see the real base, he failed before he got into the recruitment. Robotnik will have a meltdown, and probably put him into the junk pile. He misjudged the power of the drug they gave him to experience such devastating hallucinations, and now he would suffer once Robotnik called in. He turned onto his stomach and went to sleep, hoping things would be better tomorrow.

****************

Sally Acorn was meeting with Sonia, Sonic and Manic in her office for a debriefing on the failed recruits. They had already cover a large number of fails, much to Sally's disappointment, when they made it to Flint. "I don't know what was in your minds when you supported this unstable monster. His demons nearly destroyed one of our testing chambers, he is unfit to serve us."

"Sal, I think we are looking at this the wrong way." Sonic told Sally as he leaned back in his chair and rested his head in his hands. "Did you see the amount of raw power he has? I watched the tape and for a moment I thought my screen might break. We need a strong backup."

"Are you out of your mind?! He'll kill us all if we don't watch him! That murderous intent, he is a ticking time bomb before he hurts one of us. I need to protect the others in case he goes off."

"Sally, believe it or not, we are desperate for talent. Most of our recruits never picked up a gun, or even fought more than a street brawl. Now Flint is fresh, but he has talent, if unrefined. Give him the training and he will become a key role in the end of Robotnik." Sonia spoke bluntly as she stood up and leaned right into Sally's face, which the ex-Princess stared back at her.

"He will be crushed. He is used to fighting alone, his lone wolf bullshit will end up costing us time and possibly fighters. Plus our teachers will not go soft on him, he will have to face more struggles than he has ever faced before."

"Look, we're not saying the guy will save the world, but he came to us for help and some purpose. I say we try it, and give him the support he wants. Otherwise the AFF or Robotnik might get their hands on him and do the same before making him our headache again." Manic spoke calmly as Sally stared back at him, only making him shrug. "If he actually kills someone, then we drop him off at the loony bin or a high security prison, but for now you know we have a point..."

Sally frowned but slowly sighed before glancing at his final report. "IF he passes the final test, then he will be considered. I will allow him a chance to make up his poor grade by averaging it with his final. We are finished on this matter, tomorrow he will step into his next test and his actions will allow his chance to work for us." Sally then stamped his paper and put it into a file, watching the trio leave and hoping she wouldn't have to pay for another room to repair...
12511111111.title: " I don't want to talk about it."

choices: The Fight
Behind the scenes, Sally observes them
125111111111.content:
Eric rolled in his bed as he dreamt of his worries for the future before he felt himself fall and woke up immediately as he hit the floor with his face. He was about to make a smart remark about beds with no walls when he looked out and saw mist covering a room that was clearly not where he went to bed. Alarmed, Eric stood up and got his robotic side up and running, setting up his combat system that made his left eye glow red as it scanned for threats. Eric was confused at what was going on until he realized that this was another test for him as they weren't going to fail him after all.

"Hmm, this is interesting..."

Eric spoke out but immediately felt something cut the skin of his right arm and gasped out as a small spray of blood came out before he compressed it. Eric gritted his teeth but viewed a playback of the scene second by second and saw he was against some blue wolf with some type of tribe clothes on that showed her body but covered important parts. He would've found her interesting to see if she didn't have incredible speed and precision to strike without causing permanent damage, as well as a large sword that could be used for cutting him in half. Eric tore off a sleeve and tied it to his cut to soak up blood and prevent too much from spilling out, before calling out to the mist.

"So you're my test? That sword is cheating, but since I'm mostly metal, I'll cut you some slack." Eric tried to gauge where she would strike and attempted to defend as much as he could that would seriously hurt him. He suddenly saw movement in the air to his left and immediately raised his arm only to have a blade collide with it as the female wolf was trying to force it to cut through, now visable to Eric. "Hi there, you'll find that harder to cut lady." He spoke before trying to attack the wolf, only to be punched in the face before she jumped back and had her weapon ready.

"You take death rather lightly fox..." The wolf told Eric as she stood ready for any attack, pointing the tip of her sharp sword to Eric, who just crossed his arms and looked at her.

"I already died, you just see my shell." Eric spoke with even coldness as he realized the temperature near the wolf was almost uncomfortably freezing. "Say, can we turn up the heat, your AC must be in overdrive for it to be this cold. Can't afford good heating?" He spoke as he also glanced around for any advantages he could have but few were present.

"The cold you feel is from me fox," the wolf spoke as she straight at Eric, now planning her next move as she slightly relaxed her wrist. "Some say I am frigid or icy cold, but dealing with it and me is your problem. A good fighter for our cause must be able to adapt and to succeed in situations where the situation is dim. Prove yourself by beating me, and you will become a Freedom Fighter."

"When beat you, how about we grab dinner together to celebrate?" Eric spoke warmly, surprising the wolf but she just frowned and shook her head at him, giving him a glare that he shrugged off.

"Feeling confident, do you? I wouldn't even if you beat me three times."

"Shame, you must turn heads at work letting everyone see your body and curves like this. Or am I that special to get to see you in it?"

That seemed to tick off the wolf as she angry stared at Eric and took a step forward, making Eric take note. "Look buddy, I don't know where you grew up, but these are traditional fighting clothes in my clan. I'm not wearing this so I would show off my midriff to you! Now shut up and fight or I'll cut lower next time you talk like that about my heritage!"

"A little touchy are you? Good to know." Eric then got himself ready to take down the wolf with assistance from his interface. "I'll get you for a dinner if it kills me."

"I'll stick with the latter, and you should know fox, those thoughts you're having about after that dinner are delusional." The wolf spoke as she got into a fighting position, nearly growling at the young fox who was trying her patience with his jokes and open looks at her body like she was some kind of doormat.
125111111111.title: A different foe and unknown force

choices: That night, debriefing with Eggman
The following morning...
1251111111111.content:
Eric and the Wolf fought a long and terrific battle, with near misses of mortal wounds and high speed, it was hard for an outside viewer to understand what was going on. Yet the fight was a standstill, with the Wolf standing tired but only lightly bruised while Eric was bleeding from several cuts and was covered in bruises and swelling, however still standing. Both gasped for breath once they stood in front of each other again, taking a small breath in the fight.

"I don't get it, I hit and cut and he still stands. At this point, most surrender, yet he doesn't look like he wants to stop." Frost thought as she held her sword, which had gotten rather dull after hitting Eric's robotic side over and over, staring at the grinning blue fox. "This is just like that other fight a month ago, but what could possibly drive him to keep going?"

Eric grinned and weakly laughed as he was completely exhausted and was trying his best not to collapse, as his limbs were well used up and his battery was nearly critically in need of energy. He however felt challenged as he was up against a foe who was powerful and with every hit and movement was teaching him new ways to fight his enemies. Her style was blunt power and rapid precision, and with some tweaking, he could make it work with him as well as the many others he had observed and recorded. Plus he finally knew this wolf's name now from the image he ran through his database that he took when she first appeared, which had her as Frost Lynn, bodyguard to Princess Sally.

He had spent most of his battery and the fight reading the reports of her as he kept up with Frost, mostly intrigued by her as she had dealt with a very difficult life before she came to fight for Sally. And her history was quite a read, as he tried not to die while he came up with a plan that he was just about to get to the end of.

"Hmm, this match is a draw." Frost spoke before she slide her sword into it's sheath, starting to walk away.

Eric was surprised but pretended to look outraged for the audience behind the fake mirror he spotted during the fight. "You can't just call a match like that! I'M still standing and we will finish this!"

"No, it is a draw. You are not going to stop until I rip your limbs off, and I don't feel that is necessary for a recruit. Not when your have to do exercises in the morning."

Eric felt himself grin as he knew he had made it, yet still played his role. " So I am in?"

"Yes... though barely." Frost frowned at his grin and turned away to the door. "A good warrior knows when the battle is finished, you should've walked away with your wounds, yet you let yourself be a chopping block for fun."

"I still won."

"If you weren't half metal, you would be dead. That is what made you acceptable, nothing else." Frost then opened the door and saw Eric walk pass it before she left the room and closed the door. "Flint, was it? I warn you that things will get more difficult from here. Your instructor for tomorrow is known for her fiery personality, she does not like smartasses, and will probably run you into the ground. You should rest up for tomorrow."

Eric just kept smiling and walked with her to what he assumed was his room for the night, feeling pleased he could handle the bodyguard of his future target, at least equal her power. "Maybe. When do you want to have dinner together? You know, since I beat you..."

Frost rolled her eyes again and held a firm frown. "You're still on that? I said it wouldn't happen, and I meant it. Besides, your not exactly my type, meat." She spoke roughly as she stopped at a door with Eric looking slightly confused at her. "Here's your room, be up for training at 6 in the am. Go to the sparing room for your lesson and watch your tone when speaking to her, seriously."

Eric just looked at the door and turned to see Frost already walking away, calling out to her as a few freedom fighters looked at him as they pass by. "Wait, your name?" Even though he knew it already, he had to appear weak and uninformed.

"Frost."
1251111111111.title: The Fight

choices: The following week..
The next class...
12511111111112.content:
Eric had spent the night tossing and turning as he attempted to charge his battery using a long cord directed into the grid, given though somewhere, someone was annoyed at the steady increase of power draw. His room was bigger than his closet at Robotnik's as it had enough room for a bed and a bathroom with a shower, athough it would seem normal to anyone else. When he had walked in at first, he noticed that a pair of white robes were on the bed, along with a note that was a simple "Wear this for training, recruit. Nothing else.".

The robes were comfortable, and obviously a way to make sure he was at his absoulte basic for training, but he still had the cyborg advantage. He stared back at his own face, feeling his robotic eye naming operational status of all parts, knowing that their was another set of eyes looking back at him through the green glow of the robotic lens. Yet Eric turned away and headed to the training room, which were along the hall for a while, tightening the knot to keep his robes in place as the cold floor made him relax. He knew he could learn a lot from the training if Sonic was there, or even Sally, which made his pace increase as he hoped he would be able to see the true power of the Freedom Fighter and knock it down.

He noticed several others were waiting outside a room and saw they too wore his white robes, talking among themselves. He joined them and slowly each went in, even though Eric noticed some red robes and black robes on the other side of the hall, taking note that the ones wearing them looked quite the challenge, before he joined the others. Inside, he pushed his way forward until he stood in line in a room that reminded him of a dojo, with large mats on the center of the ground and beautiful imagery of fighting and meditation on the walls. From his spot, he noticed a purple cat sitting on the ground, meditating with her hands out on her lap, sitting perfectly straight up and wearing a white robe to theirs, but with a red belt.

Immediately, one of the recruits yelled out to the cat, a tank of a gorilla with as much rudeness as he had muscles. "Hey! We're waiting to be taught lady! Get a move on!" His barking seemed to twitch one of the cat's ears before a plain voice spoke out that seemed to come from her.

"You won't learn a thing in my class. You should go home."

"What?!" The Gorilla exclaimed before he pounded his fists into his chest to show his power and authority. " How dare you?! I bet I know more than you in fighting! I've taken down my fair share of fools and I won't be insulted by a woman!"

Slowly the cat sighed before she got up and turned to face her class, her face edged with determination and a spark in her eye that told Eric stories of ability hidden in her, and simply pointed at the Gorilla with a doubtful expression. "In this room I am your mentor or Blaze, and if you wish, I will gladly show you what I know. Just step forward and fight me, show the class what you know." The Gorilla smirked and steped forward but Eric knew he was doomed to fail, recording them as he knew he needed to see what this anomaly in his database could do.

The Gorilla pumped out his chest and beat it to show his strength before he charged at Blaze with his large hands outward to hit her, using his weight to add to the intensity of the charge. However, Blaze simply smiled before she stretched her leg back and waited for the Gorilla, shocking the class when she struck. Her motions were perfect with balance and grace of a ballerina, spun in the air forewards before her foot landed hard between the Gorilla's eyes with a loud boom. Then in mid-air, she brought her hands down and swung with all her force against the Gorilla's legs, snapping the large beast of an ape off balance with one foot off the ground, yet she was not done. She then drawed her leg back in the fraction of a second where the Gorilla was off balance and then launched a devastating kick to his chest, sending the Gorilla into the air with a cry before he face-planted on the ground near the door.

The entire crowd of recruits were gasping and were impressed, even Eric who felt alarmingly outmatched in speed to the purple cat. It had seemed she had spent much more time on precision and balance that when she gained power, she became a walking tank. However Blaze seemed unnerved by her own actions and simply addressed the class, ignoring the unconscious Gorilla she had beat down hard.

"Now that is settle, allow me to finally introduce myself. My name is Blaze the Cat and I am the instructor for the new recruits to combat. You are beginners, which means you have talent, but don't have a clue how to make it work for you in combat. I will teach you exactly how to fight to take down opponents that we will be facing from Robotnik, as well as for the future of your own lives." Blaze then paused to glance at the Gorilla who slowly got up and walked ashamed to the back of the line against the wall, making her grin slightly. "I do not hold back, only from a stronger force, you'll get stronger yourselves. I also use fire in fights so there will be burns in my course, which our medical center will take care of. I am your mentor from now until you become true fighters, which might be quick for some and some might take years."

Blaze let the recruits look at each other and mumble before she put her hand out and yell out at them. "Alright, enough talking! Your first test starts tomorrow, same time, use the time to prepare yourself for the most intense training of your lives! Now go!"

Eric watched Blaze as the recruits fled from the room, admiring her beauty as well as her ability, as she was definitely a force to be reckoned with. He silently wondered how lucky he was that Freedom Fighter had such pretty women in their force as he was having a little trouble staying on task, but he knew that she would crush whatever he pointed at her in a real situation. He also knew that her speed was a huge advantage but also knew her strength was impressive, which made her the next stepping stone for beating the Freedom Fighters through knowledge.

"Hey, do you have cobwebs between your ears? The lecture is over until tomorrow."

Eric snapped out of his thoughts to see Blaze was standing right in front of him with a frown as she seemed to notice he was the only one left. "Sorry, I was just thinking about how you moved in that fight. It was rather impressive." He quickly excused himself and for some reason found himself blushing about have her close to him.

Blaze however rolled her eyes and crossed her arms. "That wasn't a fight, that was me letting him know that blunt force doesn't get you anything in a real match. As well as getting him to shut his loud mouth." She then looked at Eric sharply, as if she could see into his soul before she commented. "Sally told me about you, about the raw energy you got stored up, and how unstable you were during the psychological test. I don't care about that, if you have the ability, do your job. But if it becomes a handicap, as well as the lead strapped to your body, to your teammates or to me, then we have a problem. One I correct with force, and flames."

Blaze then gestured to the door and Eric started to head off before he caught the last comment she had to say. "If I catch you staring at my ass again, I'll kick yours off it's hinges. I'm not here to entertain your thoughts, only kick you into shape. And so help me if you try anything boy..." He immediately felt himself turn red before he hurried as he realized that he did stare a littld too much at her body while he was there, something she picked up on quickly enough. Eric just sighed before he went back to his room, knowing he need to get ready to be in the worse of it tomorrow...

Blaze the Cat however just sighed as she had enough to deal with and just closed the room down before heading off to give her report of the recruits. Still thinking about the cyborg fox boy, hoping he would not be a problem for tomorrow when she will knock some sense into her new students.
12511111111112.title: A Fiery Introduction to Pain

choices: Another few weeks go by
Meanwhile, a pair of eyes watched Eric through the camera feed...
125111111111121.content:
The start of the week had led them to dueling as Blaze set her own class against her in order to teach teamwork. Eric watches as she danced her way around four recruits with flames coming out of her limbs as she struck each when they missed, crossing his arms with the next group to go up. He carefully watched her movements as he was watching for an opening to strike when it came to his turn, no longer fit for playing around.

Eric overestimated his abilities compared to his instructor Blaze, as a week went by of training with her, he realized the game she played. After long drills underground in courses of speed and strength, as well as duels with partners and exercises of body and mind, she coaxed out their true potential. Even with his real set of skills, he found himself winded and often outmatched when placed against Blaze in duels, so much that Blaze made him a point to others on the need of endurance for more than quick fights.

Not that he could blame her, she was quick to find his weakness, all of his sneaking around and quick fighting in the dark had left him without the ability to handle a longer fight. She, of course, had no knowledge of his true goals and he immediately set himself to improve, honestly impressed how effective she was as a teacher. Blaze had even managed to help him with one on one exercises which he felt himself get stronger, something he would need if she was only the basic teacher for Freedom Fighters, and others were better than her.

However, Eric felt his patience with her was running out, as she made him a focus of daily training. Every day he had become a focus of how he didn't catch up with the class on run or how weak he was when he held back. It seemed she saw through his to disguise of a recruit and was tempting the rage of a shadow agent with a flare of kleptomania, in which he felt close to granting her wish.

"Next team!" Blaze's declaration stirred him from his thoughts as his teammates rushed her and met a predictable fate with the floor mat. He however took his time and let his feet silently go over the mat to circle her, Blaze already taunting him to attack. "Hurry up Flint, we don't need show offs! If you're going to attack, do it now so we can go to lunch!"

Eric however was not swayed by her remarks, he had a plan, one that would finally land a soild hit to Blaze as he grabbed a recruit from the ground and picked her up. "I have a plan to take off her smug smile, are you in?" The recruit looked confused until she saw his eyes and simply nodded as they stood beside each other as the other two slowly caught on and the trio joined his side. Eric recognized the three as they were long time recruits, a fox named Benny, a bird named Alexandra and a monkey named Taz and remembered their fighting styles as Blaze watched over them all.

"What is this? Am I seeing some actually brain power here? This should be interesting..." Blaze commented as she let out more flames and made the room temperature go up after Eric spoke his plan to the trio.

"Could work... But why am I going head to head with her?" Taz spoke quietly as Alexandra answered him quickly.

"Because you're loud and if my older brother taught me anything, she will focus on you first. Then I swoop in."

"I don't know..." Benny the fox told Eric as they stood together, his height slightly smaller than Eric despite his older age. "It sounds like you get the glory while we suffer."

"Benny, this only works if we all do it at once." Eric began as he tightened his knot of his robe. "We all win if she falls for it, just get ready and we could all be moving up in class rank."

Eventually Benny nodded before the four got into their stances and slowly circled Blaze, who looked generally pleased with the combined effort, ready for them. Then as quick as possible Taz rushed after Blaze and swung wildly at her with his claws on his hands and feet, amazed when she danced around him and missed his every strike. Then Alexandra flapped her wings before she spun at Blaze and pecked at the cat, while also missing Taz, yet Blaze managed to keep up with them well until she sent out a wave of flames that pushed them away.

Benny then charged at Blaze and locked his hands with Blazes as they stood together, both trying to exhert more power than the other. Blaze however just grinned as she tightened her grip and several pops were heard from Benny's hands, smirking as she insulted him. "Is this all you came up with? I'm not impressed..."

"You will be..." Benny grunted with pain from his hands but managed to laugh a little before he yelled. "NOW!" Blaze looked around for Eric but realized too late where he was right when she felt her jaw slam shut from a hard hit on the right side of her jaw.

"EAT THIS!" Eric screamed as he punched Blaze with enough force from his robot hand that Blaze went flying into the wall and dropped to the floor limply. He and Benny took a breath as the class stood in shock and several were debating to call for the medical team. "I told you she wouldn't see me if I came from below her sight." He commented to Benny as the poor fox tried to rub his hands.

"You did... but man my hands hurt. I though for a second she would snap the bones in my hands, or cook me in flames for that embrace. That was smart to have her distracted right when she dropped her guard. You just slide under the gap between my legs and nailed her in the jaw without her realizing where you were." However the two foxes were pulled away from their talk to the sound of laughter as Blaze pushed off from the floor.

Blaze stood up slowly as she held her jaw, a little shake as she stood on both feet and addressed the class with a smile on her face. "Now that is tactics. Using resources to the best you can and striking when the enemy is off guard or unable to fight back. Not a clean fight, but successive fighting." She then went over to the two of them as Taz and Alexandra came together too, the four of them on guard in case she was going to fight back but she just smiled. "You're all alright, maybe you might do well for us here."

"Class is dismissed for today!" She turned and announced to the rest of the room, letting the room empty out save for Eric. "Hang on, stay here Flint."

Benny the fox and his teammates gave him a worried look but left just as Blaze stood in front of him, making him worry about if he was going to leave the room when she hit him in his shoulder playfully. "I thought you were holding back."

Eric gritted his teeth as he rubbed his shoulder, both his mind and his computer system were yelling at him for putting his real effort into knocking her flat. "I don't know what you mean... I just got lucky..."

"Come on now," Blaze started as she crossed her arms, raising an eyebrow at him. "You can drop the act, I can tell when someone is lying to me and when they hold back. Since you came in, you've done both to everyone here but now you showed serious power. So why hold back?"

"I just have been working out..." Eric started to falsely explain before Blaze put her her claw to his right eye as she held a deadpan expression.

"Lie again and lose your one good eye. Now, again, with the truth..."

Eric felt like he was on the verge of expelling his true motives as Blaze was not the kind of woman to joke around with. Yet he couldn't tell her or risk being exposed and jailed for life, so he came up with a line that had some truth but not the juicy center. "I wanted to see how Freedom Fighters handle themselves. Seeing you in action was all I could hope for, why ruin it by stepping up and being shipped to another class?"

Blaze took a few moments before she retracted her claw and crossed her arms, thinking about what he said and how he responded before she asked him. "But then, you would see someone better than me. Why stay?"

"Well, I think you know that answer." Eric spoke as he stood close to Blaze and held one of her hands, looking her in the eye as he spoke a little too much from his own heart than his hardwiring would've liked. "I like you Blaze, you are possibly one of the most amazing women I have met, and you can handle youself against anything. Who know who I will have as my next teacher, and I like being right beside you. That's why I want to stay in your class." He then dropped a little ice breaker to fight his own nerves while rubbing the back of his head with a goofy smile. "Plus you're pretty fun to watch, easy on the eyes, you know?"

After a few moments, Blaze actually blushed in front of Eric and quickly withdrawed her hand and she tried to get a handle on herself. Yet she clear her throat and waved him away with a few words. "I um, I expect to see you tomorrow on time. This... this doesn't change your effort in my class, understood? Now... get out of here." When Eric nodded and walked out of the room, Blaze felt a little different about Eric. Sure he had some secrets, but what he said about her registered pretty low on her BS scale, he honestly cared for her and that did a number on her expectations.

Eric felt himself breath in relief as he walked back to his room and he avoided losing his cover, but also avoided angering Blaze. He felt like he should've said something else and his hardwiring said the same, but he felt a lot better with his own feelings aired out. He did like Blaze, in every sense of the word, but he was also there to scout and eventually give everyone over to his master Robotnik. As much as he wanted to resist, his guidelines were ridged, and the consequence would be his life. However, nothing prevented him from keeping a girlfriend, and maybe she could help connect with someone who could override his programs. But that required him to get close enough for her to trust him, and that required him to keep up with Blaze. He only hoped Robotnik would think that his actions were to get closer to Sally and leave it at that. One thing was clear...

The next classes would be interesting...
125111111111121.title: Blaze the Cat and Eric's first slip up

choices: The Fight
1251111111111211.content:
Since Eric's little comments back a month ago, Blaze started to act differently around Eric. No longer were there comments about his abilities and no longer were there remarks about his effort. However, Blaze seemed to watch him very closely, in duels and on the track, she had her focus on him while he got better at his own skills. Eric felt like she was measuring him up, seeing what made him tick, and what she did with her results was beyond him. She also seemed in those fight and instructions, to try and catch his eyes like she wanted him to focus on her, from her eyes to everything below. It came a little difficult to focus on the lesson some days.

Still, Eric found himself with a small group of friends, the team he used to knock Blaze down a peg as well as the gorilla from the start of class. They all seemed nice, even with his hardwiring declaring that he should make no attachments, he couldn't help but spent time with them. Pulling pranks on the Freedom Fighter with Taz and Benny, helping Alexandra with her possible outfits for the big day that loomed over them, he had almost forgotten the concept of fun. Yet he also looked forward to a day that was coming up, graduation to offical members of the Freedom Fighters, for work and personal reasons he was excited for it. His team were close to their requirements, and he was only a single no hold barrage fight to prove he met the mettle.

Yet he was also a little worried, in previous fights with Blaze, he held well to her but often fell flat at the end and got knocked around for his trouble. In the last fight, with judges standing behind protective glass, they had only barely held each other off. Even with his full strength, Blaze was always a step ahead, with his full speed, she would dance around him. So he hoped for the final test between them, he would focus on defense and counter-attacks, making sure he weathered her strikes before knocking her flat like before. But he also felt a little unsure, since he got a note that the fight would happen in Blaze's personal room, without judges or spectators, which set off a few alarms.

He walked there in his white robe as usual for sparring, hyping himself up for the fight with strategies to take her down as he knocked on her room's door. It took a few minutes before Blaze stood in her usual teacher outfit at the door but her hair was not tied up, letting him see a more relaxed Blaze then before as she looked at him. "About time. Get in here." She then let him come inside, closing and locking the door behind him, leading him to a large circle mat placed so they could fight.

"Before we start, do you mind me asking why we're doing this here?" Eric asked as he stood on the mat, looking around with interest at her room. "Not that I'm complaining, but I thought final tests were done with judges like last time."

"They are, but you don't need to worry about that. You need my approval and you'll graduate to Freedom Fighter." Blaze spoke calmly, as if she didn't expect him to win. "Consider this our tie-breaker."

"Fair enough. So let's get this over with, I plan to win."
1251111111111211.title: Another few weeks go by

choices: At his graduation ceremony, Eric meets the leaders of the Freedom Fighters
Later that night
12511111111112111.content:
The two warriors stood proudly on the battle mat, in their fighting stances for the fight that would lead to Eric's higher rank. He tried to put aside the concept that he would then be focused on taking down the whole base and Blaze, as well as the fact they were fighting in Blaze's room and she had eyes on him that were peering into his soul.

Yet his worries were interupted as Blaze launched at him with quick jabs at incredible speeds, taking all of his reflexs to dodge then and precision timing to throw counter jabs back. However they both did not manage to hit each other, unless someone slowed down and each would get hit until they sped back up. After a while, they then spilt apart before Blaze launched swift swips at his feet and at his head, which he countered by grabbing her feet and tossing her away with a spin. However she grabbed his robot arm and used the momentum to slam her feet into his chest, pushing him to the edge of the mat as his arm blunted the blow.

Eric was feeling the pressure to beat Blaze, his own system trying to kick in and knock her down. "Let me take care of it, enough of this nonesense!" It barked at him before he used his will power to shove down his Overlord program, it growled at him as he violently snarled at it in his mind "Step in and I rip you out! Now shut up, I am not going to lose!" He then launched a counter attack of jabs and swips at Blaze, feeling his system constantly intruding on the back of his mind but leaving it be for now.

The fight was pretty evenly sided, and even after a few hours of constant fighting, both Blaze and Eric were running on fumes. They had put their best into the fight, and found that they knew each other's styles well and that direct attacks were almost not worth it, since they never connected.

Blaze gasped for breath along with Eric, her hands sore as well as the fresh bruises on her body where he had hit her. "Hey, I think... we missed dinner call... how about... a break?"

"Ha... admitting... surrender?" Eric answered with a few gasps for air as he was equally bruised and hurt.

Blaze shook her head and then put her hands on her hips, taking in a breath before she exhaled. "Look, we're both tired, why not get more energy and fight at our peak instead of seeing which one will fall first? Plus I have something ready."

"I guess so... wait, what do you mean you have something ready?"

It then that Blaze rolled her eyes and went into the kitchen area, with Eric trailing behind her, as she opened her oven and used some holders to pull out a pot of curry she had left in there that was still hot and then rice from a cooker and placed them on the table. Eric was completely lost as Blaze then snapped her fingers and lit two long candles that were sitting on the table. "Uh Blaze?" Eric asked as she got out plates for them, feeling like something was up. "Why does this feel like...?"

"A date? Because it is one." Blaze replied nonchalantly before she put silverware out and then dug into her fridge.

"What do you mea-"

Blaze then pulled out a bottle of wine, but her expression looked a little sour at him. "I have never let a recruit go into my room, what, you thought I did this with everyone?"

"But you said-"

"I said you needed my approval, not that the fight would give you it." Blaze popped the cork before she poured into two glasses, then reached into her pocket and slammed a paper on the table. "Congrats, you got it."

Eric stared at Blaze a little doubtful until he saw the paper and realized she was serious, a little annoyed that he didn't have to beat her when he worked his way up to stop her cold. "So why were we just fighting then?"

"I said it was our tiebreaker, you may not like it, but I always enjoy a good fight and I'm not one for being square with some fresh Freedom Fighter. Now sit down before it gets cold."

"Remember your mission, play nice or risk losing! She is clever though, watch her closer, or be the fool again."

He felt a little irritated but sat down, starting to eat with Blaze as he tried to wrap his head around what could possibly be going on in Blaze's, but was having no success until he realized something. "Hang on, their are rules against teacher's dating a student, isn't there?"

Blaze just swallowed before she gave him a predatory smile that made him feel a little uncomfortable. "There are, but not for fellow Freedom Fighters, so you are free game."

"Ah..." Eric felt himself start to blush, as he figured out she had played a game with him, leading him to her room and her little dinner. He almost felt upset that he fell for her game. Almost.

"You said you wanted to be by my side. And you made a little remark about my body while you were at it, how it was easy to look at." She smirked as she drank her glass, his expression of embarrassment apparent. "I play for keeps Eric, and if you want to back out, now would be the time..."

"Get up and leave now!" Eric's programing boomed in his head. "Forget her and go after Sally, that is your mission!"

Eric felt his legs move but he quickly stopped them and instead put his hands on the table, getting Blaze's attention. He knew he would be breaking all the rules that his master put into place, but he had the chance to have a normal aspect of his life, something he'd fight to the death for. So he grabbed his glass and downed his wine and let himself smile honestly for the first time in a while."You're not going to scare me away Blaze, I'll stick with you until you get sick of me."

"NO ATTACHMENTS!" His programing screamed inside his head, making Eric wince silently before he pressed a button on his arm that turned on whitenoise programing he put in to shut it up.

" We'll see how you do, and a word of warning, if I feel like I'm not happy I will kick your ass." Blaze spoke with a little venom before she got remarkably sweeter and grabbed the bottle of wine. "Would you like some more?"
12511111111112111.title: The Fight

Current Girfriend, Blaze the Cat
13.content:
Eric woke up with a bad headache as he slowly got up from the rather stiff metal bench he was sleeping on the inside of the cell he was locked in. Eric checked his systems on his arm for a damage report as he could feel blood dried under his nose and his chest hurt to find he broke a rib and had a concussion from his latest misadventure.

He looked down at his dirty blend-in clothes and saw a dark stain of red in his otherwise white shirt but didn't feel like it was his as his black zip off pants had dirt caked on the knees. His amber sneakers were falling apart, as usual, but this time he was missing the laces on one and the tongue on the other. He then cleared his throat and called out unimpressed to the officer sitting outside of his cell with a mug of coffee and the local paper.

"I'm ready to make my phone call."

The officer didn't look like he was listening, so Eric got up and went to the bars before banging his robotic arm against the bars to make a loud metallic ring. "You already used your phone call before you passed out." The officer stated as he turned the page, equally unimpressed.

Eric sighed at this before he sat down and hung his head in his hands. "Is she here?"

"Yep. She stayed the night."

"Damn it."

The officer then faced Eric for the first time and put down his paper for a moment. "Want me to let you out?"

"Can I stay in here for the rest of my life?"

"So... five more minutes then?"

Eric rubbed his hair and eventually stood up before shakingly walking to the bars again. "Haha, real funny. I'm glad my situation is hysterical to you. Let me out, might as well get it over with..."

***

Eric was escorted through the Mobotropolis Police Department or the MPD by the officer in a pair of cuffs. Not the first time mind you, he was known by name to every officer in there as " The Trouble Child" when he was young and now TTC since it was quick with their insults. Eric however was being given special treatment now as he dropped his connection with the evil Dr. Julian Robotnik and now did work as a Freedom Fighter.

It was a rough couple of months since he spared Robotnik's life and supposedly turned over a new leaf. The hardest decision he ever had to make, and hopefully will ever make, that turned out to be a regret he had. Eric wanted him dead for all that he had done, to him, to the citizens he controlled, his family, but he couldn't do it. Now the tub of lard was off in a hideout hatching a new scheme, all thanks to him. At least some of his lackeys were taken down as well. Scratch and Grounder became servants and Sleet disappeared with Dingo, presumably arrested. Eric liked Dingo, even if he was stupid, he was a friend before real friends and helped made his nights comfortable with conversation.

However, his life as a thief was a harder sell. More of a hobby he started as a child after some thieves took him in, it was something he was really good at and helped in his missions requiring stealth. It was also the resason he was in the station, he stupidly got drunk and bragged about stealing the ring of a very wealthy aristocrat and got into a fight with three officers, knocking two down before the last one managed to zap him with a taser. Not his best day...

Eric was then brought into an office where the brass sat and saw the face of the girl he wished wasn't there standing next to the desk.
13.title: Exchanging one side for another...

choices: A brotherly talk
They get stopped before they get there
A month later...
131.content:
Eric saw the face of Princess Sally Acorn, which was formed in a frown and had eyes that looked incredibly disappointed at him, as she stood next to the desk of the police commissioner. Eric nodded slightly to Sally before he sat in the chair in front of the desk and waited until they would leave.

"Thank you, I'll make sure he doesn't do anything for a long time." Sally thanked the commissioner as she started to go towards Eric.

"Last time I do this, otherwise his next cell won't have a key and all of his previous charges will suddenly be remembered." The police commissioner stated plainly as he stared at Eric, who just gave him the finger until Sally slapped and dragged him out of the office.

***

Eric and Sally were driving from the police station, Sally drove while Eric sat quietly in the passenger. For most of the ride, things were quiet, until Sally pulled over and just sat there as traffic went by.

"Why'd we stop?" Eric asked as Sally turned off the vehicle and then rubbed the bridge of her nose.

"Six months."

"What?"

"You couldn't control yourself enough to stop being a bonehead, so you are now restricted to base for six months. You also have to hand over all of your tools."

Eric frowned but slowly took off every single one of his tools for thievery and put them in the backseat. "Fine."

"Also no mission time, strictly desk work. And I swear Eric, if you mess up again, I will drop your ass in that cell myself and revoke your status as a Freedom Fighter."

"I get it."

Sally scoffed and looked like she was going to slap him again. "Oh, you get it huh? Seven times you got into fights and got caught stealing from our allies and you get it... now?! You have to be the most stubborn and idiotic thief I know, even Manic got it together, but you can't even stop for more than a month without casing a score. What do you even get out of it anyway? We provide your bed, a roof, meals, you don't pay for anything, we pay you! Instead, you go out and take what isn't yours for what? Some cheap thrill?"

Eric was quiet and Sally sighed and started up the car and drove again. As they parked in front of the base, Eric saw Blaze and Tails standing by the door, Tails worried, Blaze furious. "Shit, you can still drive me back to the cell, step on it."

"Oh no, you are going to face them yourself. I will make you face a therapist after Blaze tears you a new one, mandatory, so you will get over it. Now get out of my car."

Eric tried to resist and got kicked out of the car in front of his brother and his girlfriend and slowly got up before Blaze socked him in the gut. "You idiot. You had us worried sick." Blaze then grabbed Eric and pulled him into the base with Tails following by, trying to loosen Blaze's claws that were digging into Eric's fur.

" Blaze... Could you let me and Eric talk...? Brother to brother?" Tails asked as Blaze she shoved Eric into a wall with her claws digging into his shoulders.

"Fine be quick, I need something to punch something, I'll be at the training room." Blaze stated before she walked briskly away before she hurt her boyfriend. Tails shook his head and brought Eric to his room he shared with Sonic to try and figure out what was going on with his brother.
131.title: His boss, Sally Acorn

1311.content:
Eric and Tails sat down on the beds as they looked back at each other, both remaining quiet for a while until Eric shrugged. "No big talk?"

"Not if you don't want to." Tails replied calmly but kept his gaze on his brother. "But you're beating the hell out of yourself, and maybe you want to talk to someone who will listen. So, go ahead." Tails then crossed his arms and remained quiet.

"Look, I have work to do, talking with a therapist from Sally and a bunch of deskwork. I don't want to do this now." Eric spoke rapidly as he got up and went to the door out of Tails and Sonic's room.

"You need to get it out eventually, and if it isn't me, it will be Sally or her therapist. I want to help, think about it before you go and get yourself in more trouble. And watch for Blaze, back there was her holding back."

Eric took a deep breath before he nodded and put his hand on the knob. "I get it, and I will keep it in mind. I just hope I can walk tomorrow to work after Blaze gets me."

Tails frowned slightly as Eric rushed out of the door and slowly laid on his bed, worried about his brother and his issues with letting the past remain in the past. He hoped that someone would figure out how to get him in order for his new life as a Freedom Fighter, as his brother moved along a self-destructive path if he kept up his nonesense.
