142111.content:
As Frost walked down the stairs, she was greeted with the sight of a monster sized ox who stood with his neck bent in order to avoid poking holes in the ceiling with his massive horns. He stood several inches taller than her father, wearing green silk robes to show his endurance and connection with their nature, with his clan's emblem on the back, although Frost imagined him with battle armor and a huge axe that would level buildings with a swing by the muscle that spanned his body. He had deep dark blue fur simular to her father, but his gut betrayed him even under the robes, bloated with many a feast. The Ox King himself was speaking to Frost's father, who strained his neck staring upwards and discussed tribe matters, but it was the king's son at his side who caught her attention.

Dante stood about half of his father's size, he had much more growing to do but it was clear he had not changed. His black fur was as spotless as it was ebony and he seemed just as arrogant and stuck up as before with his frown as he looked over her home, like he was staring at something he stepped in. He also wore robes that matched his clan but they were red which did not surprise her as he was to project his ability to fight to the death for what he wanted and show off his looks that some girls went gaga over for her. However Frost felt that his outfit didn't suite him, as for an Ox, he was the most underhanded and cowardly. He was not much for open battle, but for tricks and lies, and that made her watch him carefully. Plus the fact his looks did him no favors with her, as she spent most of her time without caring what she looked like and went on what was comfortable.The idea that they would be married made her gag, but not as much as the thought of her having a child with him. Yet her thoughts were stopped when they caught eyes, silencing the house around them as the two locked their focus to read each other, trying to exerting their dominance over the other.

"Frost dear, so glad you could join us, why don't you sit with us as our guests eat." Her father raised his voice to get her attention, quietly waving her off from her staring contest as he also addressed his wife Rebecca. "Dear, tend to the fire and make sure we are well stocked to feed our guests."

Frost glanced over at the King and Dante and made her way to the fireplace, where she stood with her father until their guests sat opposite to them on the sofa, then they both sat down in their chairs. She watched as King Ares noticed their wooden bowls filled with dried meats and fruit as well as a pot of stew that filled the room, seeing him nudge his son before they both filled spare bowls with what they saw. Rebbecca immediately went to replace what each Ox had taken with fresh supplies as they ate, moving back and forth as the Ox King and Dante ate their fill. Frost felt less anger as she saw Ares treat their customs with such respect, something his son barely had, and sat with her father as he waited patiently for them to be full. It took a few minutes before King Ares put down his bowl with his son's and put his full focus on his host.

"Thank you, Rebbeca for such a wonderful meal and helping us get out of the elements. And to you dear man for allowing us the honor of meeting in your home. I brought a gift to honor the occasion, I hope you accept it."

Frost's father sat patiently as the large Ox dug into his pockets and presented a single kinfe that looked like a relic from ancient times, but held the same symbol of his clan. Her father gently took the knife and examined it with a soft smile before he put it above the fireplace, returning to his seat once he was done. "We will treat your ancestor's blade with the respect we have for our own. Thank you and the Creator for such valued company, but I suppose we must discuss our tribe's future."

"Aye, we shall." Ares dug into his pocket's again and pulled out a paper that he handed to Frost's father, before he took a breath. "This will be the symbol of our trust in each other, all you have to do is sign along with your daughter once we cover what shall be expected. Now, I hope it goes without saying, but we cannot have my son marry your daughter until we meet the requirements by both of our customs.

"Of course." Frost father spoke immediately. "In our customs, she is much too young to marry, so we ask that your son wait until she is in her teen years. We also desire that there are two ceremonies, one for our tribe and one for yours, as we hold to honor both our ancestors and your own. Finally, the first born son will head our tribe and the second born son will lead yours after your son Dante."

Ares however frowned before he scratched his chin in thought, speaking aloud. "Very well, but our tribe has a tradition that the strongest sibling becomes King. This applied to me and my oldest brother, as it did for my great gran-father, so what if the first is the strongest and not the second?"

Frost's father also frowned in thought with the Ox King but came up with a simple solution. "Perhaps a third born? And the measure of strength could be between him and the second born?"

"That could be acceptable." Ares nodded, however he noticed Frost made a sour face when her father mentioned a third son, making a note of it but pressing forward. "Our tribe also has a tradition where on the night of the wedding ceremony, the two must consummate their commitment. I trust this will not be an issue?"

Frost felt a part of her wanted to declare that she was never going to mate with Dante, but she knew how this would look, and possibly be misunderstood as spitting in the Ox King's face. Yet Rebecca passed her a look as she moved behind the two Oxes, as if she had pieced together what her daughter felt, but her father answered for her.

"My daughter will honor your custom, only give us time to educate her, and she will not insult your son once she takes his hand."

"This is good. Now why don't we let the children go off to your daughter's room and talk, while we discuss details of our clans?" Ares asked as he nudged his son again, snapping the black ox out of staring into space in boredom, giving Dante a firm look.

"Yes, lets give them time to learn more about each other while we talk details. I'm sure they must be tired of hearing us ramble about the future." Frost father spoke with a smile as he turned his back to the Ox King and faced his daughter with serious eyes. "Run along sweetie, please be courteous to Dante, as he will be your husband one day. Go."

Frost did her best not to scowl in anger as she stood up and went to the stairs, letting the black Ox follow her, but refused to address him as she let him into her room. However she now had a way to speak to Dante in private and explain her case, even though he was a dick, she hoped he would back off her and tell his father to withdraw the offer. Yet even as she looked at him judging her room, she felt like the battle had just started and not ended, pleading silently that nothing would jeopardize her secrets.
142111.title: Ice Wolves and Ox Clans decide Frost's path

choices: The Next day, with Samantha at her father's forge
1421111.content:
"So this... is where you sleep?" Dante commented in disbelief as Frost walked in and closed the door, shaking his head as he turned to face her. "I half expected an Iron Maiden, or a bed of needles for your attitude when you address me."

"They're at the cleaners..." Frost answered sourly, her hands on her hips and a scowl clear for the Black Ox to see. "Dante, why is your father coming here and asking my dad for me to marry you? Does my temper draw you like a moth to a candle?"

"Ha! If you're a candle wolf, then I am your wick, soon to be buired deep into you!" He laughed heartily until he got a vicious slug to his gut, dropping him to his knees as Frost pulled back her fist, clearly not amused with her eyebrow twitching with barely contained anger. "How should I know...? I figured you father made a deal... in order to have peace between us. I don't have much of a say either... do you think I care to marry you?" Dante coughed out as he clutched his stomach, slowly getting up from the floor.

Frost just looked at the black Ox and shook her head, considering the merit of truth to it, yet feeling no regret for hitting him. "No... you'd rather have someone you can manipulate, you know I'd put you in your place. Fine, but you need convince your father to drop this."

Dante scowled and sat on the bed, much to Frost's anger, yet he just narrowed his eyes. "You think I haven't tried? He doesn't care, it's all about the fate of the tribes or whatever. I'd rather our troops raze this place to the ground, leave you troublemakers to the wild like you deserve!" He however sighed and crossed his arms, making a small pouting face. "Oh well, maybe we'll destroy another tribe like yours did the NightBloods, that could be our honeymoon. Besides the sex, I mean."

Frost felt her claws come out as her patience was being tested, but slowly relaxed and let them return, standing right in the Ox's face. "There isn't going to be honeymoon or wedding. You need to know something about me Dante, but what we say does not leave this room. "

"Oh? Do tell..." The Black Ox perked up, immediately and intrigued with that of a secret, especially from his future wife.

"I'm... I don't like guys that way, I'd rather be with... well... girls..." Frost mumbled out, feeling extremely uncomfortable with telling the truth as she had spent so long keeping it a secret to him. However, Dante's response made her feel even worse, with the cackle of laughter as he gasped for air.

"You're a lesbian?!"

"A what?" She asked back, not as familiar to it Samantha had described their attachment as 'gay', yet she felt like he was insulting her from his outburst.

"Oh this rich, you don't even know what it's called! It means you get turned on by girls, you like them more than a guy! You're gay! No wonder this deal makes you worried! You don't want to get your cherry popped."

Frost however just stared at him, steamed and clenching her fists tightly to sock Dante again, and nearly shouted at him. "I don't know what fruit has to do with this, but I'd never want to be with a bastard like you!! Tell your dad to drop the deal or you won't get a single kid from me! I'd rather die!"

"Really?" The Black Ox grinned, his sly smile maded her skin crawl as he got up from her bed and poked a finger in her face. "Fun fact, I'm not the one with the problem. Your dad's deal requires that you get laid, preferably by me or your dad and mine might get angry. If you back out, you'd risk embarrassing your clan and putting them in danger. In my clan, putting others in danger counts as treason, which the consequence is death. I believe your clan shares these beliefs as do we, so why don't we make a little deal so everyone is happy?"

The Ice Wolf growled as she felt that he had something planned, but sighed and crossed her arms again before she responded. "And what deal could possibly be worth it coming from you Dante?"

Dante grinned before he went over to Frost's desk, where her sword laid in it's sheath, picking it up and examining it. "Well, I don't want to mate with you anyway, but as my father said, you have to consummate on our wedding day. So I propose that I screw whomever I like and you just play housemaid in our home, only to be considered my wife at formal events. You can do whatever the hell you want as long as my clothes and house are clean, maybe even find someone who likes you. Who knows, I may find you someone to play with while I'm looking!"

"Your Housemaid...?" Frost bared her teeth in rage, the thought of being a servant to Dante made her entire body sick.

"Well, yes. Clean my sheets, clothes and tidy around our home, make meals on time. And the tribes will never know the difference, well, until it is time to get a child." Dante commented as he pulled her blade out and spun it in the air, not seeing the dark cloud of hatred forming over Frost. "I have to get a child from you, so I may just put my seed into you after my own fun and once you grow the children they want, you can do whatever. If not, I tell daddy about who you are and watch as your father get beheaded by my dad.Think about it, I'll see what you think on our next visit." The black Ox then drove her blade straight into the wooden floor and wiped his hands before he left Frost to herself, going to get his father to leave.

She could see the cold logic to what he wanted from her, but her heart burned to the thought of Samantha and the thought being someone servant in such a demeaning manner infuriated her. She was a hunter, historian of her clan, a Warrior! She was no one's housekeeper, especially to a manipulator like Dante. It must've been his way to get her back for how she treated him. If she was disgracing her ancestors, they wouldn't mean much if they wanted her to be a prisioner in what would be her own life after fighting for freedom and peace in the previous eras. As she pulled her blade from the ground and back into it's sheath, Frost knew that she would hate every second of Dante's deal. However, she could be able to live what she wanted from the start, between the bastard's plans for her.

Frost shook her head as she heard the Ox's leave their home, hearing her father call up with joy in his voice. "Excellent, the groundwork is set with our clan's future. Tara, I am so proud of you for doing this for our clan, get some sleep. We need to prepared you in the education of marriage by the next year, so our friends can see your progress!"

She scowled in anger before she got into her bed, furious on what she was forced into, but couldn't see many options that didn't lead her into danger for herself or for her own clan. Frost however sighed and turned her head on her pillow, hoping she could come up with something in the morning...
1421111.title: Devil's deal

choices: A few days later
14211111.content:
"By the ancient ones, that sounds awful!" Samantha exclaimed after Frost spent the better part of the evening telling her about the dinner and Dante. The lioness tried to keep herself contained and put down the hammer used to beat hot metal into shape on the anvil, rubbing her temples. "That... bastard Dante trying to control you, I can't wrap my head around this hole you're in."

"I know, I wish I could've striked him down, but then war would've run it's course." Frost sighed as she leaned against the fencing around the forge, exhausted from the whole ordeal as well as her morning lessons. Her mother tried to teach her about being a proper wife, all of the little details about home care and how to act, in place of what would've been training with Aaron. The one good thing was that her mother seemed to support who she was, even offering some advice about how to be with other girls, much to Frost's delight. Her mother even offered to help nudge her father into accepting her, which would take time to whittle down his resistance to the concept.

"If you don't do it, you could die and we get into a war. If you do and don't let Dante mate with you, the same happens. The only way this ends is with you miserable for the rest of you life with that pig!" Samantha scowled as she tried to think of ways to get her best friend out of the situation she was in, but was failing. "You can't do this Frost! You need to try and get your dad and Ares to back off... somehow! I won't let you suffer under him!"

Frost however shook her head, feeling almost defeated. "It wouldn't work. My dad started the deal and thinks that this is the best for the whole tribe, he won't back out just because of me. Ares is just about as stubborn, even Dante couldn't sway his mind, he would listen less to me. No matter how I play it, I have to get married to Dante and make a child, or you and everyone are in danger.

Samantha kept scowling as they watched villagers go by on their tasks, right when the lioness got close to Frost and whispered. "What if you run?"

This alarmed the young Ice Wolf as she made sure no one was nearby before she responded in a low tone. "I can't leave! All I know is here, I wouldn't even know where to go beyond our hunting lands, let alone what dangers there are."

"But what if you had a map?" Samantha answered back, her eyes serious as Frost tried to keep watch on passing people. "My parent's have one hanging in our house, you could take it and flee to the east."

"Sam..."

"No, listen to me." Samantha interupted as she grabbed Frost and held her close, staring into her eyes after she pecked Frost's cheek. " You will be miserable with that pathetic excuse of an ox, the last thing I want is for you to be unhappy. If not running, you need to stand up to your father, make him change his mind so that you don't marry Dante. That way you can stay here... with me."

Frost immediately blushed as she always felt her heart beat faster with Samantha, yet swung her head around to see if anyone saw them, but was relieved when no one was nearby. "I told you he won't listen! I've been after him for a while about it and-"

"No, I mean you tell him the truth. About you, and who you really are." The lioness stated seriously, shocking Frost for a few moments before she continued. "No more half truths, you stand proud about yourself and he will regret how he has been. At the least he will call off the deal if you won't lay with Dante."

The Ice Wolf choked past the shock and felt the nervousness she felt before with confronting Dante about who she was come back. "I... I'm not sure I can do it... My dad holds to the old tradition, if he found out I'm gay, he might exile me! I can't leave you behind Sammy! No, the best choice is to continue hide it for now and find someway out."

Samantha looked a little disappointed, which almost broke Frost heart, until she sighed and hugged Frost. "Alright, I'm sorry for pushing you into telling him and running. Just know that if he tries, I'll be right behind you, now get going or my father might come out and yell at us for slacking. I'll see you tomorrow?"

"Definitely!" Frost grinned happily before she kissed Samantha on the lips, leaving the lioness a bit flustered as she headed out to train. She just wanted to avoid the confrontation and move through it quickly, even if it wasn't the right call. The lioness chuckled before she picked up her hammer and started to beat a white hot piece of metal into a blade.
14211111.title: The Next day, with Samantha at her father's...

choices: When Frost wakes up
142111111.content:
Frost had spent the last few days through her normal life routine, sparring with Aaron Whiteclaw, spending evenings playing in the forest and talking with Samantha about their feelings. She felt more comfortable being with her and tried to keep her mind off the idea that everything would change in a handful of years. Frost's mother had more of a chance to speak to her daughter and together grew a much closer bond, something Frost had wished in her past and was thankful it came. They had talked more about her feelings and Frost told Rebecca about Samantha which didn't seem to phase her. She wished the same was for her father, but he seemed like he was worse, watching her more and wanting to know where she went during the day instead of coming home immediately. Frost worried her cover was blown, yet she thought he was being protective as she was roped into an arranged marriage and he must've wanted to keep her from screwing up the deal.

Frost rolled her eyes at her father, as she wasn't stupid enough to do something to get the Ox's attention, nearly a week from her father's deal with the Ox King. However, she did care for Samantha which they were more of a thing, yet they stayed quiet about it to the tribe. She had decided to meet her friend at the smith under the shade of night at the end of her friend's shift, hiding a pair of wild flowers she had picked for her behind her back. Frost had already come up with a cheesy line to present the gift as she walked quietly pass the homes of her village, knowing if she was caught sneaking out, her father would get angry. She made it to the smith and saw the lioness watching the forge fire burn before she turned to see the wolf with startled yet curious eyes and a whisper. "Frost? What are you doing here this late? We can't be seen like this..."

"I don't care." Frost brazenly declared to her friend, which it caught her off guard, even more by the flowers that appeared in her hands. "I wanted to get this for you when we were out today, wild flowers for my wild girl." Even though Frost tried to keep a straight face through her lame line, Samantha hugged and kissed Frost while surprised by this surprising side of the wolf, making Frost's heart and head soar with delight. They held each other before pulling back and smiling at each other, until they both heard a voice.

"Tara?"

Frost immediately flinched as she recognized the voice, spinning around to face her father who stood on the steps to the forge, too starled and terrified to speak as he watched them. Every single bad thought about how things would end if her father found out rushed into her head, stepping back instinctively from the possible threat her father possed. She prayed in her mind for help from the old gods, while simultaneously cursing her misfortune.

Her father's face looked completely confused, as if he couldn't understand what he was seeing in front of him, yet as soon as Samantha stood between Frost and him, he went off by sputtering incoherently. "You're... you just... You DARE threaten our safety?! How can you do this to our tribe?!

"How can you?" Samantha answered for Frost, despite the ice wolf's pulls on her shoulder, staring down Frost's father as if he was without authority. "You sold your daughter away for peace, if anything, you are the one who messed up."

Frost's father narrowed his eyes before he back-handedly knocked the lioness away, ignoring her as she fell to the ground, instead grabbing his daughter by the back of her neck and pulled her away from the forge and her closest friend. "By our gods, what have I done to deserve this...?" He muttered to himself as he ignored his daughter frantically trying to remove the cold grip on her neck that made it hard to breath, flailing her legs as they went. They moved past the homes of the tribe, which saw their leader and her yet no one moved to stop him, some of the Warriors following behind him until her father spoke. "Go to the blacksmith, keep him and his daughter under guard until I come to them. If they resist, make them submit." The Warriors simply nodded and left quickly the way they came, as if seeing a child dragged away was a daily occurance.

Frost realized where they heading, back to their home as it came in front of them, before her father picked her up effortlessly and tossed her through the entrance. The effort made the curtain come off with her, and alerted her mother at the pot in the fireplace what was happening, making her run over and untangling her daughter from the cloth. "Tara?! What is going on, are you alright?!"

"I'll tell you what's going on..." Frost's father spoke coldly as he stood in front of the two on the floor, his finger pointed accusingly at his daughter with a face full of fury. "She was kissing the blacksmith's daughter!"

"So you put your hands on her?!" Rebecca hissed back at him, craddling Frost's head which got a cut from her head hitting their stone floor. " Tidus, this is our daughter, not some orphan on the road, our daughter has the right to be with anyone!"

"You knew about this?!!" Frost's father howled as he grabbed Rebecca's shirt, yet she just stared him down when they locked eyes. "The fate of our tribe rests on her, and you let her play around with other girls when she should be getting ready to marry to the Ox's?! My daughter will not lay with women, not when the fate of the tribe needs her child!""

That is when Frost stood her ground, standing up before shouting right in her father's face. "I don't want to marry him or have a child with him!" She had gotten both of her parent's attention before she continued at her father. "You never cared to listen to what I had to say, I never told you how I felt about girls because I knew you'd do this! I can lead the tribe just as much as you, as all of our ancestors have, but you can't accept that! Samantha is my life, I love her and nothing will change my mind! I know in my heart we can survive without the deal you maded to pawn me off like some thing!"

Tidus growled when Rebecca put her hands on her hips, watching her join her daughter's side after he let go of her shirt. "How naive, you have no idea what you're talking about. I am the leader of this tribe, the decision falls to me, and me alone. The Ox Clan's military far exceeds our capabilities, the deal will save us, but only if you stop this nonesense! You will stay away from her or you will kill us all!"

"Stop hiding behind her and lead the tribe to safety then." Rebecca got back into his face, her claws extended to strike yet she stayed back. "You talk about leading us, but you're bending over to please the Ox Clan, even giving away your daughter to do so! What kind of man cowards behind a little girl to save his tribe?! "

"How dare you?!" Tidus narrowed his eyes at his wife, his eyes full of rage, before he struck her hard with a punch to her face. Both Rebecca and Frost were stunned at his actions, even when he knocked his wife down and continued to hit her on his knees that they didn't know how to respond. "I have to make the hard choices to lead us from our doom! This is for the fate of our children decades in the future!"

Frost felt the walls of her home blur away as she watch her father attack her mother, every part of her body wanting to stop him yet equally feared for herself. She watched as her mother finally struck back, clawing her father's face and kicking him off her, wiping the blood from her face. Rebecca then grabbed a sword from the wall, the sword Tidus' grandfather used to finish the last war, swinging it at her husband's head like her old battleaxe. Yet it was not enough to Tidus as he kicked her in her gut, slipping the blade from her hand before he slammed her head into the edge of a metal shelf, shocking everyone in the room..

Rebecca gasped as she backed away, stunned by the extent Tidus went in their fight. She tried to move toward Frost before she collapsed to the ground with a deep cut in her head. Even Frost's father was shocked by what happened, quietly staring at his wife, as Frost ran to her side and tried to wake her. "Help! Someone get a doctor!" Frost cried out the door, holding her mother and trying to put pressure around the wound to keep it from bleeding. Tidus slowly went over to Frost and tried to pull her away, yet Frost simply picked up the blade and swung it at his head."You monster! You killed her!"

However she could not hit him as Tidus knocked the blade away from him before he hit her so hard that she was knocked flat to the ground. "That's enough out of you, this is all your fault! I have to get you to stop this behavior." The last thing Frost saw before she passed out was her mother laying face down on the ground with a small pool of blood formed at the edge of her head, while her father picked her up.
142111111.title: The end of Tara Lynn

choices: The birth of Frost Lynn, survivor
1421111111.content:
Frost slowly woke to the sound of locks shutting, her eyes adjusting to the dark of her cell, save the moonlight that beamed in from the window above her. Her head throbbed badly as she tried to sit up, knowing well that she had a nasty black eye from the swelling near her right eye. She looked around to get her bearings when she realized she was in a cell, then realized everything before she was knocked cold. "Mom!" She called out frantically, but the cell had no one else but her, a window and a metal door with a sliding metal slot on it at eye level. Frost then heard footsteps before the slot slid to the left and a pair of red eyes peered at her that seemed awfully familar.

"No yelling Frost, or you will get into more trouble." A strong deep voice spoke behind the door, yet Frost recognized the eyes and voice as Aaron Whiteclaw, her teacher. "The rest here are not in a good mood."

"Aaron! I'm so glad your here! What happened to my Mom!" Frost moved to metal door, ecstatic that her mentor was outside. "Please! Tell me she got to the doctor!"

A pause hung in the air as the eyes glanced away for a while before returning, Aaron talking softly as he did when he taught her. "She's with a doctor, along your father now. It looked bad, but I trust the woman to pull through, she is not one to give up and neither should you. Try to be quiet though, everyone is on edge right now."

Frost slowly felt her legs give before she sat down at the door, taking a breath as she hoped her mother would be fine, yet she trusted her mentor's judgement and knew it was a matter of time. "Why am I in a cell?"

"Your father put you here, said that you needed some time to change your behavior away from girls. Told us to keep you here until you cry uncle and stay under his control." Aaron answered distastefully, glancing away as if he was keeping watch. "He also said not to feed you, something about 'an empty stomach changing your tune'. However, I snagged you something." Frost cupped her hands near the slot and felt something drop into them, realized he got her a cooked rabbit leg before she dug at it, feeling hungry as soon as she smelled it. "I will not be apart of starving a child, especially my student and friend."

She wipped her lips as she felt slightly better, yet her thoughts turned to the lioness in her heart, going back to her mentor. "What about Sam? Is she OK?"

Frost waited through another pause as Aaron seemed to be worried about eavesdroppers, yet her heart dropped when he finally faced her again. "Things aren't good for her and her father, the blacksmith resisted the guards and they hurt him bad, maybe even Samantha and barricaded the door to their home. Your father seems like he wants to send a message to them, which could end badly." When he saw Frost start to tear up, he quickly put his white furred hand in to hold her hands. "I'm truely sorry Frost, too many horrible things have happened tonight."

Frost held her teacher's hands in comfort before she got up and wiped her tears away, ready to get to action. "I need to save them, Aaron, I have to get out of here! Please let me out!"

"I....can't." Aaron looked down before he faced her again. "I swore a duty to serve your father when I became leader of the Warriors, to defend the interests of our tribe and it's leader. He told me to guard this door, and keep an eye on you. I want to help you, but I cannot turn my back on the promise I made in his service, I just can't..." When Frost turned away from the door holding her hands close together in prayer for Samantha and her mother, she heard the clunk of something else dropping from the slot in the door before facing it again. "However, I WASN'T told to prevent you from escaping through the window, or to give you the key to unlock that gate keeping it close, allowing you to save your girlfriend. So I can keep my promise, and help my student do what she can."

Frost grabbed the cold metal key from the ground and put her hand to the metal door with a small happy smile. "Thank you Aaron, I may not see you again, but I will never forget this."

"Go get'em kiddo, I'll keep an eye on your mom and tell you when it's safe to come back. Just don't be surprised if I have to play the role of his servant in order to stay close to your mother. Keep you head down, get Samantha and her father and get to safety for a while." Aaron told her as she climbed up the wall and unlocked the gate, watching her climb through it while keep a straight face for the others patroling the cells, wishing her the best.

*********
Minutes later....

Frost snuck away from the prison with full stride to Samantha's home, she watched as warriors patrolled the village and moved around them until she got to the lioness' home. The front and back enterances were blocked with furniture and she could smell something weird the second she got to the side of the building, yet she couldn't remember where it was from. She slowly scaled the wall until she got to the roof and went to the hatch she used to sneak into the house to see Sam in the past, happy it was still unlocked after all this time. She quickly went down the ladder, down a flight of stairs before she got to the bottom, quickly talking as she entered the main room, spotting Samantha bent over the floor. "Sam, grab your stuff and your Dad's, we need to go now!"

When Samantha didn't move, Frost went to shake her out of it, and saw a sickening sight over Samantha's shoulder. Her father laid on the ground, each of his limbs were broken in the wrong direction, his nose bloodied yet he was still alive. "They shoved us in here..." Samantha spoke softly as she was still in shock, not moving from her dad. "Dad tried to stop them... they... they..."

"Hey... hey...come here." Frost picked up Samantha and hugged her, shocked at how the guard treated the older lion, and wondered what would happen to her, Samantha and her own mother if they stayed. "Sammy, I'm so sorry, but we need to get out of here. The Warriors are up to something outside, we can't stay here."

"I can't leave him!" Samantha cried out, shoving Frost away and going back to her father's side. "Frost, my dad is all I have left after my mom passed away, I can't lose him too! I just can't!"

Frost grabbed the lioness' shoulder again, even after she tried to shrug her off. "We can't lift him, he's at least 400 pounds!"

" By order of Tidus Lynn, leader of the Ice Wolves, we commit your souls to the Ancients. May your end be quick and forgiveness eternal." A voice called out as Frost glanced out a window to see several warriors with torches coming to the home, making her realize what was happening.

"Samantha! Grab your things now! They're going to burn the house with us inside!" When Samantha didn't move, Frost shook her friend to snap her out of it, yet she clinged to her father as fire began to spread from the walls. "Damn it, I won't let you die here, we have to go! Sam! Sam!"

"Leave me."

Frost was completely stunned by her friend as the lioness turned to face her close friend, her face set like stone as they stared at each other. "I can't leave my dad to die alone, not after my mom. It's what I want, more than anything, take the map and go far away from here." Samantha pulled out the map from her pocket, holding it to Frost with tears in her eyes the same as the ice wolf.

"No... I can't leave you like this...! I love you Sammy, I want... us to grow old together..." Frost confessed before the map was shoved into her hands, being pushed away by the lioness she cared deeply for as flames danced around and between them.

"I love you too, but my place is here, and yours is beyond these walls. You know I'm right."

Frost felt every part of her wanted to grab the lioness and drag her away to save her, yet she found the willpower to put away the map in her pocket and slowly nod through the tears running down her face. "Goodbye Sammy."

"Goodbye Frosty..."

Frost didn't know how she got the strength to take the first step to turn away from one of the only people she cared for and the steps after to escape the fire. All she could feel was the hole in her heart that burned with a pain beyond what she had ever felt, and the drive to put that hurt into vengence on the one man who caused it to happen.
1421111111.title: A Hard Choice

choices: The Final Farewell
14211111111.content:
Frost flipped the hatch open and dropped from the roof before dashing away from Samantha's home and the guards watching it burn to the ground. She could heard noises from the house, but tried to keep moving as there was nothing she could do, even though she feel her heart emotionally killing itself for leaving her love behind. Her heart also burned with the fury to strike down her father, yet she held enough sense to understand rushing him with her claws would only have her killed, leaving her father's tale he spun to remain. She felt Aaron words ring in her ear on a loop as she stuck to the shadows towards her home."Keep you head down... and get to safety for a while." Frost had failed to save Sam and her father, but the least she could do was follow the guide of the last elder she trusted completely.


As quietly she could, she got to the side of her home and climbed the stone wall she had under her window, careful to move past the ones that she had knocked loose on other climbs. Frost hung under her window before pulling herself up and glancing through it in case someone was inside, finding no one, she slowly opened the window she never locked and slipped in. Her first move was to go to the door and close it, although as she moved to pull the door in, she heard loud shouting downstairs from what she realized was her father. "What do you mean she escaped?! How the hell did you lose sight of a nine year old locked in a 10 by 7 cell?!"

"I'm sorry sir, she climbed through the gate we use to deliver food, I don't know how but she must've unlocked it." Frost didn't recognize the voice but it sounded like he was one of the prision guards in charge with watch.

"You would've seen more if you and those bumbling fools weren't playing cards! Get everyone to find her now! Dismissed!!" Frost creeped over to the stairs, listening in as her father flipped a heavy piece of furiture, fuming intensely. "This day couldn't be worse. I find my daughter with a girl, I lose my temper and Rebecca decides to try and kill me for it, and now Tara is out there somewhere. Why couldn't she just behave, why did she have to make this so difficult?"

"Maybe this is her way of expressing herself." Frost recognized the voice as Aaron, but didn't go down the stairs in case she was seen. "You always said she had a strong spirit, does it surprise you she has her own opintions about you plan?

"It doesn't matter how she feels. We are on the edge of war, either she marries that old ox's son, or we have to fight. Their numbers will set our home on fire, unless we make nice. I'm doing this for the fate of all of our children, she will just have to understand when she is older. At least that lion and his daughter are no longer a problem, now I just need to get Tara to see things my way."

Frost felt a rage burn in herself as she moved away from the stairs and back into her bedroom. Her father blamed her for everything, took it out on her mother and on her friend. She needed to leave before she went down and made a huge mistake, going to her bed and finding all of her stuff laid out. Frost wondered why her sword and pack were already there as she thought her father took them, but chalked it up to Aaron, grabbing each as well as her bow and quiver. After slipping them around her shoulder, she headed towards the window to leave her childhood home, yet something was gnawing at her. If her mother was truly going to pass, she owed it to her to protect one of her most precious valuables from her father. Quickly darting across the hall towards her parent's bedroom, Frost went to the small chest above her mother's dresser, slowly taking out an ancient obsidian blade inscribed with runes. The blade, as her mother told her, belonged to her ancient ancestors when the Ice Wolves first were contacted by the Night Bloods. The blade was offered from the Elder of the Night Bloods at the time as a sign of peace, as well as food for the start of the village. " So much could have been different if they hadn't attacked us..." Frost thought quietly as she put the blade in her single strap satchel.

She turned to leave before she was confronted by her father, who stood in the doorway with the same blade her mother tried to use on him. "Put down your things Tara, you are not leaving."

"Yes, I am. I am not your prisioner." Frost defiantly stated, pulling out her short sword and holding it for battle in both of her hands. "Or would you try to kill me like you did my mother?"

Tidus growled and shook his head, his eyes burning with the anger he did little to hide. "It was an accident. I made a mistake and she tried to kill me with this sword. Put down your blade, I don't want to hurt you but I will if you keep pointing that thing at me."

"No, not after what you did to Samantha and her father! You set the guards to burn down their house with them in it! I loved her, and now she is dead because of you!"

"Loved?" Tidus scoffed at his daughter, slowly bringing the blade up as if he was also ready for a fight. " You're too young to know what love is. What happened is best for all of us, that girl almost ruined the possibility of peace between our tribe and the Ox Clan. All you have to do in order to prevent war is marry Dante, have a few kids and everything goes fine. She was distracting you from your true purpose."

Frost stared incredulously at her father, shocked by the manner he treated her and Sam, like they were just pawns in some kind of game of his. " My true purpose? You killed my friend to marry me off for peace! You don't get it, I hate Dante, I don't care about your plan for peace or whatever game you're playing with the Ox King. I don't care about marrying and having kids because that's not who I am. All I wanted to do was spend my life with one person that I had feelings for, to support this tribe the way a true leader does, and now you robbed me of even that."

"Stop being selfish, you can't let personal feelings decide what happens to this clan, to your people. You need to grow up and realize this phase will pass, and you will help your son to lead our tribe once I am gone. Stop pretending and be the woman you're suposed to be.

"I CAN'T BE SOMETHING I'M NOT!!" Frost shouted before she started swinging at her father, even though he dodged every strike she sent at him enraged by how he could not see her for who she was and could only see the image he created of her. "I KNOW WHO I AM, A PROUD MEMBER OF THIS TRIBE, AND THAT YOU KILLED OUR OWN!"

Tidus caught Frost's blade and put pressure on his daughter's attempt to attack him, taking a breath before he locked eyes with her. "So be it, you've left me no choice. May the gods forgive me for harming you." Tidus then thrusted his hand into her face before the power of light blinded her, forcing her back before she blocked a kick that knocked her straight through the window lock....
14211111111.title: The birth of Frost Lynn, survivor

choices: When the white snow bled...
142111111111.content:
Frost was still dazed as she landed on the hard cold ground of the forest, yet just barely able to stand up and face her father who landed on the ground several feet closer to the house than she did. Tidus stood strong with his blade in his left and in his right hand was a ball of pure light, which cut through the veil of night other than the home burning behind him. Her father was known for his light and heat based attacks, which was ironic since the "Sun Warrior" fathered a child that enjoyed the cold and water.

"Is this what you want? For you to strike me down in rage?" Tiidus asked of the young Ice Wolf that was once his daughter, yet pointed his blade at her like the foes of his past. "So be it! I'll make you regret the day you dared threaten our tribe's future!"

Frost just growled as she charged the older wolf that was once her father, slicing at him and parrying his counter strikes like her mentor taught her. Her own powers had already kicked in, sending a terible snow storm throughout the town, almost forming a blanket of snow by the strong winds rolling through. As much as she had rage and adrenaline on her side, her father had decades of experience and several feet taller than her, so it was not long before she was knocked back hard to the ground not cut as he taunted her by whacking her with the side of his blade, but decently bruised. She however got up again and continued to strike as fast as she could continue to manage, yet was caught with a kick directly to her face after another blast of heated light in her face, making her struggle to see her father staring at her with unwanted pity.

"Damn you child, stay on the ground! You cannot hope to defeat me, just surrender, and you can lick you wounds in the cell until you pull yourself together." Tidus pointed his blade by her head, noticing a number of guards including Aaron run up and pull out their blades. Frost however had a different idea, as she sunk her blade through her father's left leg, yanking it out before she ran from his pained yells, ducking away from the guards who started to rush her. "Aaahh! Someone shoot her! Whiteclaw! I order you to shoot Tara!"

Aaron waited a few seconds before he addressed his general, giving Frost a few more seconds while also holding his men from firing their bows after her. "Sir? That's your daughter!"

"She is no longer my daughter, now fire, that's an order!"

Aaron frowned but slid his bow off of his shoulder, taking an arrow with his hand as he aimed and stretched his shot at the young Ice Wolf he trained, watching her enter the tree line as he tracked her. His different promises made his hand shake a little as he didn't want to hurt Frost but had to stay close to protect her mother. He gritted his teeth before he jerked his bow slightly upwards before firing, watching his shot soar through the tree line as well as a surge of the village's hunters and warriors going after her, following them as Tidus screamed for a doctor.

************

Frost heard a few of her father's howls as she ran by the trees in the forest, the soft crunch of the snow between her toes as she fled her home with her own members of the tribe chasing her. After an arrow nearly skinned her head after entering the tree line, Frost tried to keep her body low in order to avoid more attacks, feeling eyes on her as she kept going. She kicked up her powers until the storm made a blizzard form around them, making it hard to see her, yet the warriors were trained well for the cold tundra of their homeland. She had hide occationally in order to shake certain warriors, but the hunters were still on her trail.

It was only after she got to a cliff that she realized she needed to double back, yet as she turned she heard a noise before her chest exploded with pain, seeing the feathers of the arrow that had just lodged itself into her chest. Frost felt her legs start to give as a hunter stepped from the trees, her vision rolling upwards to the sky as her body fell over the edge, too numb to move as she fell down the cliff...
142111111111.title: The Final Farewell

choices: The Kindness of Strangers
1421111111111.content:
Frost slowly faded back into consciousness, each of her limbs stirred in the cold snow until she was able to sit up and push off the snow that covered her. Her chest burned with icy hot pain as her hand gripped the arrowhead that had dug through her chest, realizing that her chest was soaked red. "That's my blood... that's a lot of my blood, gods..." Frost struggled to examine her surroundings and saw that she was at the base of several large trees with branches broken all the way up from her spot to the base of the cliff in front of her. She looked around for the hunters as they were on her tail and one shot her, yet it seemed like no one followed up on her fall, assuming justly that she would've died from the arrow and the drop.

When she moved to stand, her chest surged with enough pain to drop her back on the ground, clenching around the wound with a gasp. "Gods... please make this bearable..." Frost prayed as she gripped the shaft of the arrow in front of her, remembering her lessons with the town healers and knowing full well that she was going to hate it as she snapped the arrow's shaft. The jerk instantly made her yell in pain, but quickly bit down on the arrow piece that she snapped off from in her chest, knowing she had to stay quiet or be found. Tears ran down her cheeks as she gripped the arrowhead from behind her with luck and snapped it off after two attempts, trying her hardest to keep from scream out by breaking her knuckles on a tree to make it more bearable. The healers had told her that leaving in the arrow shaft would cause her pain, yet they also told her than an arrow in the chest has a high chance of infection if not treated the second it came out. She did not have the skill to sew up her wound and not any herbs or salves to keep infection away so she had to go with option B.

Frost took a roll of bandage wrap and wrapped it around the wound without putting pressure directly on the wood, knowing her efforts would stop the arrow shaft from moving around and causing internal bleeding that she could not stop. It however did nothing for the pain ripping around the wound and throughout her right arm, making her wish she had anything to dull the bite, yet she stood and took her time walking from her landing zone. With her left hand she pulled out her map and followed away from her home and the owners of the piece of paper she was using, keeping a clear eye out for anyone. In her condition, she wouldn't last in any fight and she knew that at some point her legs would give, yet she damn was not stopping until she had to, not letting her father win.

She traveled for a distance, enough that she made an inch on her map, having to turn off her powers in order to keep her strength during the journey. She nearly stumbled into the ground as she wandered past the forrest with the shade of darkness around her and towards what would've been a grassy plain, estatic when she saw a fire down the hill in the dark of night. Frost made her way to the fire, a step after the other until she finally collapsed at the edge, seeing figures start to surround her and pleaded through the fog in her vision. "Please... I need a doctor..." She could barely understand a word being said as she faded into unconsciousness, but could feel someone pick her up from the ground before she lost herself in the fight...
1421111111111.title: When the white snow bled...

choices: The morning arises...
14211111111111.content:
The light and crackle of the fire softly stirred the young ice wolf from the darkness, opening her eyes to see the flames dancing in front of her. Frost felt warm yet she felt the cool of metal under her body and turned her head to find that she was in a cage for a small animal, shocking her out of the numbness of her nearly last dreams. Picking herself up off the ground, she sat up to figure out where she was and why she was trapped in a cage like prey, her chest burning in pain with each muscle used.

Frost stared past the campfire to see into the camp she stumbled upon and was scared with her surroundings. She saw several more cages with a few full of others like her, finding two animals cooking a boar that seemed like her captors to her left. The two were dressed in the furs of animals, yet acted like they were crazed, hollering and laughing while drinking from large bottles. They seemed less likely to let her go and more likely to do other things, especially with the area next to the cages that was soaked in blood that looked like the butcher's shop back home. She turned back to the right and was shocked to see a pair of eyes staring right back at her, the eyes of a large winter lion.

The lion stared at her with unwavering focus, wiping his blade with a cloth that was stained red, immediately moving Frost away from his side of the bars. He had a scar across his left eye like someone had tried to blind him, and a weird metal thing hanging on his side. Frost's looks brought a toothy smile to the lion's face as he took the metal thing and pointed it at her, speaking to her in a language she had never heard before. When she didn't act the way the winter lion wanted, he pointed it in the air before his finger pulled a strand of metal and the sound of thunder erupted, making the ice wolf grab her ears. Never had Frost heard of an object that contained the power of lightning, the power this lion held alarmed her as her powers of cold seemed to do nothing to the large lion, as her own weapons were inferior.

The lion let out a laugh while the two cooking the boar ran over and began to yell at him, pointing around the woods like they were meant to be silent and hidden, snatching the gun from his hand and tossing it into a bag piled up near their tents on the right of her cage. "Wait a minute..." Frost said as she moved to the right side of her cage and caught the sight of her bow and bag by the tent where a fourth was going through it. "HEY! That's my stuff, get out of there!" When the fourth didn't pay her any attention, she formed a ball of ice in her hand and tossed it at their head, not content with someone going through her cherished belongings. That didn't fly well with the fourth who stood up and went to the cage of hers with a machete, banging it against the metal and kicking the cage to scare her but leaned in and scowled at the ice wolf, her face illuminated in the fire as a purple leopard. The leopard seemed to speaking in what Frost assumed were death threats as she couldn't understand a word of their language but the motions of the blade in her hand were unmistakable.

Frost bared her teeth to her captor, a mistake she face when the cage door was opened and the leopard's boot slammed her head into the bars of her cage, knocking her out immediately by the sheer force of strength, without even hearing the cage slam shut and lock...
14211111111111.title: The Kindness of Strangers

choices: That night....
142111111111111.content:
The camp had to move after the confrontation in the night, not willing to risk drawing attention from the unfamiliar shadows of the land. The cages of the prey were loaded onto their salvaged cargo truck before being driven away by the only two not drunk or high to take the wheel. The winter lion and the purple leopard sat in the front while the two morons sat with the cages inside the container.

"Status?" The winter lion spoke into his old radio, watching the snow covered road while also watching the brooding teenager in the passenger seat.

"We're rocking back and forth here. Can you try not to hit every stone in the road?"

The lion narrowed his eyes with annoyance as he purposely shook the truck, hearing groans through the radio. "It's what you deserve for getting wasted on duty, now quit whining and keep watch on our stock." He eventually straightened out and continued on their trip, only to hear another insightful comment from the leopard beside him.

"They were the best you could find? Those two morons spent more time getting sauced than keeping watch on the perimeter. It's no wonder that native girl stumbled in, when they were focused on their dinner."

The winter lion kept his eye on the road, but the edge in his voice was undeniable. "The way I remember it, you were lighting up before their lips touched a bottle. We work with these two because it would be harder to do this by ourselves, as you remember." He watched the outline of a clearing appear at the horizon and made for it, yet also focused on the purple leopard girl he was in charge of.

"I'm not hurting anyone, and it helps me relax J'skar. You drink and I smoke, it's just a little to take the edge off." The purple leopard crossed her arms in defiance, staring out the window as they pulled up to the clearing.

J'skar turned the engine off and watched as the two in the back started to move crates of their stuff and the stock out, turning to face the leopardess who was already out of the truck. "Keep an eye on it or it will be an unhealthy habit. And watch over that blue girl, I think she might be the most valuable one of the bunch. You know the rules Ashley..."

"Yeah yeah, pretty young girls who speak a different language are worth more in the right markets, without being too roughed up. Whatever, she tries to hit me with that ice again, I'll break her fingers. Rule or no rule."

J'skar grimaced at the young girl's temper as he knew and told her it would be her downfall, yet she had to learn on her own like most of her life. He stepped out of the truck with the map and looked for a place to offload their cargo, pulling out his cell and flipping it open to dial a number, hearing the line connect before he spoke with warmth unlike him. "Hello dear boy, I have some stock for sale... Yes better than the last ones... As a matter of fact I happen to have hold of an exotic... an, how you say, young tribe girl with white tatoos and an outfit to fit her form... The price?... Why don't we start at triple the regular price..."
142111111111111.title: The morning arises...

choices: The Deal of a Lifetime...
1421111111111111.content:
"Eat the food! You know how to eat, stupid native girl?!" Ashley growled as she tossed a dog bowl of meat back in front of the blue tribal girl's cage, frustrated on how she refused to eat and would knock the bowl away. It didn't help that the two were at each other's throats since they set up the camp after she bite Ashley's fingers that went into the cage to drag her off the truck. The language barrier didn't help as several times the girl spoke in length in her language but Ashley had zero idea what it meant except for the ranting when the girl got pissed. Yet again the girl kicked over the bowl, getting Ashley to flip her off and walk away. "Fine! Starve, but don't be asking for anything later!"

Frost however finally sighed as she had peace and quiet, pulling from her clothes a piece of metal ripped from the truck in order to try and break out, working on the lock while her purple captor smoked something from her pocket that smelled weird when the leopard exhaled. She knew that the group who had caught her were slavers, and knew that it wouldn't be long until they off loaded their stock by the number of others in her exact situation. Frost gripped her chest as another wave of pain came from it, gritting her teeth as her wound still hadn't healed and would most likely hurt for a while to come, yet she tried to focus despite the sounds of the other captured trying to convince their captors to be freed in their different languages with predictable results.

The ice wolf was surprised that her wounds were tended to, after what she had seen from the captors, yet it seemed like they wanted her alive and not dead as she was close to after falling unconscious at their feet. She shifted her eyes to the winter lion and the two who enjoyed some kind of drink in the same bottle as before, watching them point at their map and her own from Samantha, wanted to break out and stop them for every crease they were causing. However her focus came back to her task as the snap of her metal tool signalled her lack of results, getting her to growl as she would have to spend another night in her cramped cage. Frost however perked up when she heard the butchering of her language to describe a town on her map, now understanding they were going to it when the lion used a word with it that she heard him say to a metal box before.

However, her understanding was not hidden from the leopard who was still lighting up, who watched with interest as she had found the way to talk with the prey, but was too loaded to do it right. Ashley simply continued on her watch as the winter lion barked orders to the two nitwits to get them ready to head out to the meeting point in the morning
1421111111111111.title: That night....

choices: The Mobius Soldiers Arrive, A Start of a Slippery Slope...
14211111111111111.content:
The banging of cages inside the truck echoed in Frost's ears as she stared right at the two sitting at a stack of small boxes. They had been playing a game all night, shuffling a deck and playing one card after another until one groaned out of disappointment. Gambling was discouraged back home for adults, but kids played a few staples while their parents were preoccupied. She knew that the truck was heading somewhere she could escape from, she just needed something to use in case she saw an opportunity. Frost had been eyeing a knife that one of the two had attached to his boot all morning, seeing the care put into it's blade that was not seen in anything else the two touched. She could work with a blade sturdy enough to pry the door open on her cage and sharp enough to damage any who followed after her. It was pure joy that the two were either too drugged by that drink they liked or too careless to put her cage right next to the one with that knife, which she quietly took and hid just as the truck began to slow down and make sounds like it did the last time that they stopped and pulled out the cages. Frost took breaths and tried to ignore the pain in her chest as it was finally time to act, ready as the rear door slid up and sunlight poured in...

J'skar squinted in the sunlight as he jumped out of the truck, seeing the remains of a tribe settlement in the distance through some trees. He pulled his gun out and loaded it as the truck was unpacked, making sure to scan the grassy area. Ashley joined him at his side, lighting yet another joint until her mentor grabbed it and stomped it into the dirt, glaring at her. "I said take it easy, now get your gun ready. That customer is coming soon, but I don't trust that this deal will go smoothly without some persuasion. Follow the drill and make sure those two are clean too."

"You said that he was a repeat customer, he wouldn't be stupid enough to punk us if we are his source of slaves. Besides, he's not going to be able to cry cops with our lack of any decent life around here for miles."

J'skar narrowed his eyes at the young girl that he took in and protected, putting his arm around her shoulder and pulling her in close. "Never underestimate." He spoke as his yellow eyes stared into Ashleys, their eyes locked together like two pieces from the same puzzle. "This guy is a means to an end and we are the same to him. All it takes is him to turn the Mobius Soldiers on us and we'll be locked in a hole of a prison or killed."

"Boss, car coming from the south."

J'skar and Ashley turned toward the car's direction and got their guns out and ready, prepared as the blip of a car slowly grew until it parked several feet from the two and their cages set up. The doors slowly opened until two tall mutts appeared and opened the rear doors for two others, one tall like the others and one shorter. The two in the front waited patiently as the tall and short mutts approached J'skar, the short dog dressed in an expensive suit with shades and a business hat grinning with his pointy fangs and stretched an hand out to the white tiger. "J'skar, my good friend, bringing new meat are we?"

J'skar slowly gripped his hand and squeezed it until the mutt was squirmed uncomfortably, his eyes watching the bodyguards every move before focusing on his customer. "Do you have my money?"

"Please dear boy, we haven't even had a look at your selection yet. Rest assured we are prepared to pay, but only when we see something we like." The Customer walked toward the cages, looking as the two guarding them before looking through each one at their captive.

J'skar however raised his gun, causing both sides to raise their own weapons, aiming right at the Customer who just stood looking at the cages. "That wasn't our deal. Proof of money first, then you got to see the stock. Where is my money?"

"It's in the trunk, you need to calm down before you cause trouble." The Customer waved away the tension and smiled as he found the ice wolf he was looking for. "You said she was hurt, not that she has a hole in her chest. That is going to affect how much she costs."

Frost wasn't sure about this situation as she sat in her cage, unable to understand their words but the looks the mutt gave her made her skin crawl. The white tiger and the mutt kept arguing between them as they gestured at her, clearly deciding what her life was worth. She readied the knife behind her as the two talked, waiting for the moment where she would run for her life. Frost looked at everyone and saw more metal objects that caused the thunder she heard before, scaring her that she couldn't hope to avoid those weapons that seemed worse than arrows from bows if they saw her escaping. She was snapped from her fear when the Customer rubbed his hand beside her cheek, immediately she opened her mouth and chopped his hand hard. It was reactionary, yet the Customer punched her hard in the face to get his hand free then back away after she fell backward.

"AHH! She bit my bloody hand! If she infects me with some tribal disease I'll come for you J'skar!"

The white tiger actually chuckled and smiled, showing his teeth to the mutt throw threats as he stood face to face, watching the Customer's rage simmer down to caution. "You asked for the real deal, she's as fresh as can be caught. I'm not settling for less than a million, she will be a looker as she ages and she's covered with muscle to do hard work. Yes she is injured and she can't speak a damn word or understand one from us, but she is the best deal of your lifetime. Last chance, or we have her ourselves."

As the Customer was making up his mind, Frost took the time to crawl over to the lock and jam the knife into it while eyes were off her, yet didn't count on the watchful eye of Ashley who was scanning the horizon before she turned and pointed into the distance something that would alter their life's forever...
14211111111111111.title: The Deal of a Lifetime...

The day after
1422.content:
The grind of the stone on her blade edge soothed Frost as she sat, waiting for her friend to come and tell her when she was needed. She felt the blade's sharp edge cut her finger as she tested it, swinging it the air to remember her ease and comfort with her old sword. It had been a decade since she was exiled from her home, and with the upcoming fight, she would come home a hero. Her father would have to acknowledge her role in their clan, and welcome her with open arms, which made her hands shake with the thought of it. She took a few breaths and calmed down until her hands were as steady and ready as a surgeon faced with the task ahead, putting away her sword to ease her nerves.

"The Night-blood will die. Asher give me the strength to finish this once and for all." She thought over and over, also praying to the old gods from the ancient times, not noticing the squirrel who stepped in until she put her hand on Frost's shoulder.

"Frost, our newer recruit has completed the first test and in a few hours, he will face you in the second test." Princess Sally Acorn spoke, leader of the freedom Fighters and Frost's boss, seeing the tension over Frost's body. Her bodyguard barely spoke of her homeland, but the one thing Sally knew, is that the Night-Blood clan burned a rage deep into the ice wolf's core. ""Are you prepared to face him? I know there is a lot of bad tension between your tribes, but you cannot kill him."

"What would you have me do Sally? His tribe are backstabbing murderers, I will not let any of them live as long as I do."

"I would ask you to restrain yourself." Sally answered back as her personal guard stood up and walked the length of her personal room, noticing the tribal cloth she wore, feeling that it held a status in her tribe as well as the white warpaint she wore all over her fur. "And not condemn him because of the acts, which may or may not, have happened by his ancestors."

The ice wolf however just stared at her leader and friend, her eyes narrowing accusingly as she put her hands on her hips. "And what about his ties to the Anti-Freedom Fighters? I respect you Sally, but you have no idea what you are talking about! That Night-Blood is a danger to everyone here, and I will not let him hurt a single person!"

"He would be a valuable asset to our cause and he is offering a chance to redeem himself. I am not asking as a friend, but as your boss. He will not die or I will no longer need your services, I can't pass a resource like him without consideration, so if he wins fairly you will drop it. Do we understand each other?" Sally stared into the eyes of her friend, who looked like she was hurting in her eyes from some past memory, crossing her arms and standing her ground.

"I will keep him alive, but...just...barely." Frost growled as she stood up, the spark in her eye made Sally nervous, as she stormed out of the room. "Whether he survives me is up to him..." She knew Sally was close to confronting her about her issues, but she didn't care. Frost had one last hunt, with a prize greater than any animal she had took down. She would do anything to get back home, to be welcomed by her father and tribemates, the pain of homesickness was unbearable for her to deal with any longer.

14222.content:
The Nightblood was in his room in the Freedom Fighter Base, meditating and praying in the center of the room as he was surrounded by dim lighting. While he was praying, two spirits came close to him as he was praying. One was a female nightblood and the other was a male nightblood.

The Male Spirit spoke first, "My son, for the last time, will you slay the daughter of the clan who murdered your kin?"

The Nightblood broke his prayer for the moment but did not look at the male spirit as he responded, "I will not. She is not my enemy."

The Male Spirit then shouted, "Of course she is your enemy! Her kind wanted us destroyed and wiped off the map. How long do you think she will remain your ally?"

The Nightblood answered back to the Spirit, "Long enough to convince her that I am nothing like the rest of my kin, Father. I am not like the other Night-Bloods, you of all of the people should remember that or do you not remember when the moon turned red on the night of my birth..."

The Male Spirit then retorted, "Bah, you are no son of mine." After that, the male spirit was quiet as the female spirit came over to the Nightblood and placed her hand on his shoulder, smiling as she spoke kindly to him, "Don't take his words to heart, my child. His honor drives him to hate the clan, but you...You understand that it wasn't your fight. But this Ice Wolf, she will not make this easy for you."

The Nightblood responded to the spirit, "I know she won't, Mother. But I will not make it easy for her either. I will not kill her, but I will prove that I am not like Father or the rest of my clan. She is driven by Honor, but she has been blinded by that honor. I must be the light to show her otherwise."

The Female Spirit then added, "I know you will do your best, my son." And with that, both spirits vanished and the Nightblood went back to praying, finishing off slightly more audible than before as he looked up, looking at the shut curtains that were in front of him while staying in his mediation: "Amonkira, Lord of Hunters, Grant that my hands be steady, my aim be true, and my feet swift. And should the worst come to pass, grant me forgiveness."

The Nightblood was ready for this challenge and waited for someone to get him so it could begin...

Frost stood in their largest sparring room, slowly gathering her strength as she dropped the temperature of the room to sub zero levels. She admired the snowflakes that fell from the ceiling before a blizzard took over the room with winds that howled throughout the space. She felt in her prime as the cold nipped at her fur, pulling out her sword and pointing it directly at the door where her foe would come, letting her rage and anger motivate her to victory. The blizzard would mask her approach, and then she would strike.

She could not save her older brother or change what happened, but the least she could do was take down whatever Nightbloods dare poked their faces up. Frost had killed in her past, but not out of spite but survival under the harsh reality of the world, a small part of her wondered if she could actually deliver the killing blow. Yet all she needed to see was the image of her brother laying in the snow, stabbed in the back in cold blood by people who were once their friends, and she felt that hesitance melt away. Asher prided himself on a fair honorable fight, how they treated him so horribly boiled her blood.

Yet she also was burning with the desire to know why, why there once friends would betray them, why it had to be her brother, and why this Night blood managed to survive. If anything stayed her blade more it was her desire to pick his brain, before she crushed it with her sword.

info.description:
"Some of the greatest battles will be fought in the silent chambers of your own soul." Ezra Taft Benson.

This holds the story of Eric F. Prower, he is a blue fox and the brother of Tails "Miles" Prower from the Sonic Fandom. A little background on Eric for those who do not know.

Eric and Tails lived with their parents in a home far from the city. They lived happily under the leadership of Max Acorn or King Acorn until the betrayal of both Naugus and Dr. Julian Robotnik, now mostly known as Dr. Eggman. After securing his title of ruler, Eggman then began to roboticize all citizens of Mobius to become his slaves. At this point he visited the Prower family home while the soon to be Freedom Fighters made it to Knothole for the first time. Only Tails managed to avoid Eggman, the rest of the Prowers were not so lucky.

Now a physical description of Eric.

He is a blue furry fox that is about 101 cm tall and about 34 kg, which is pretty much average compared to most of the characters in Sonic. He has green eyes and a rather mischievous smile to go with it. Eric is much thinner than Tails as being a prisoner for years can do that and helps in his abilities. After his encounter with Robotnik, Eric became a cyborg- half fox and half machine, containing multiple super computers. He has an A.I. named Cynthia who helps keep him alive in drastic situations.

The collection of other stories included involve his sister Jasmine A. Prower, a tribal Ice Wolf named "Frost" Lynn, and Samuel Friar. A description of each will be present at the start of their chapters, and will detail their lives as they happened. Feel free to add, but please don't put random stuff in, and I have veto power if I don't like it.

If in the stories, you want to change their appearance, please leave a description of what changed so the rest of us are not clueless.

Any questions, please email me on my account. Enjoy.

Note- the quote by Andrew Ryan from BioShock is not my property I do not claim it as mine. I give all credit to the writers and creaters of Bioshock.
